loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
Bih H. is a widow with four children. She lives in Nitop in Bamenda, Northwest Cameroon. Being a widow, she must fend for herself and her children, in this case through her firewood business. Additionally, Bih has encountered problems such as illness within the family and problems faced by her son in the Southwest region, costing Bih much money to remedy the situation. Notwithstanding that, Bih H. is quite ready to fight through life to the last moment with every morsel of her strength.

This is why she became a GHAPE beneficiary in 2008. She prefers to work with GHAPE because their loan conditions work well for her. This is Bih’s second loan from GHAPE. She plans to buy firewood, then transport and split it. Firewood is always needed in her community, so her business is sure to be successful. With the profits from this loan, she plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs and pay off medical bills. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business and financial management, basic health maintenance, life skills and family values. Clients are also required to deposit a small amount of money into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to split and sell

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuân Thị Lê, born in 1969, lives in Xuan Trach, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She lives with her parents-in-law, her husband, who is a builder, and her daughter, who is a worker. She has two children: her son is in the military. Xuân Thị Lê's main job is farming, but she raises pigs, too. In her free time, she looks for additional work. The family's monthly cumulative income is about 5,000 VND. Xuân Thị Lê is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 4,142 VND to buy pig feed.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Vẻ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1957 and has two children. She would like to borrow 4,578 VND to use for her small business.

Luyến Thị Đào was born in 1966. She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of 5,014 VND to buy goods to sell.

Đông Thị Nguyễn was born in 1974 and has two children. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,014 VND to buy food for the domestic animals she raises.

Thủy Thị Lê was born in 1971. She makes rice paper and wishes to borrow 5,450 VND to buy rice.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel trabaja en la confección de mantas y polleras tiene una tienda en alquiler; tiene 4 hijos, si bien viven en casa propia la misma es de adobe y ladrillo ubicada en la zona Nueva Jerusalén Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.
El esposo trabaja como transportista inter-departamental.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (tela), de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Isabel.

loans.use: compra de telas para su negocio de confección de mantas y polleras.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is already 37 years old. She is married to Victor who works as a soldier. They have three loving children, namely, Mark Anthony, 18 years of age, college level; then Karen Joy, 15 years of age, a fourth year high school student; and Kevin Mark, 9 years of age, a grade 3 student. The family is presently residing at Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. Their house is located near Alinam Elementary School.

Marilou has been engaged in retail vending for almost two years; her weekly net income is Php 1,000. She desires to a apply for the loan amount of Php17,000 for additional working capital and for business expansion.She wants to buy additional commodities for her store to acquire more customers. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Bawa G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “Help The Poor”. She is 42 years old and married with five children aged between 4 and 20 years old with educational levels of kindergarten through 12th grade.

Bawa is a 9th grade drop-out due to poverty. She and her family live in the Plumkor community, a residential area that is very crowded with people that migrated from rural Liberia during the civil crisis; it is south of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Bawa’s business is foodstuffs. She buys foodstuffs wholesale like pepper, seasoning, garden eggs (eggplant), etc., and sells retail on a table to residents of her community. She has been running this business for nineteen years and started with LRD 2,000 (approx. $30). She organizes her goods and sells at an ideal location, satisfying her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She is hoping to improve to a shop.

Bawa needs this loan to purchase more pepper, salt and seasoning to improve her business. She dreams of building a house for her family and changing their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more pepper, salt and seasoning to improve her business

loans.name: Mary Apondi

texts.en: Apondi is twenty four years old, married, and has been blessed with a two year old son.  She owns "Mama Tony Fashions" where she makes and sells dresses to local customers at Manyatta market.  Her business challenges are strong: there is competition from similar businesses, and significant price inflation of materials for making dresses.  She will use the proceeds of KES 15,000 to purchase rolls of fabric and tailoring materials.  In the future, she wants to open a big tailoring shop.  Apondi describes herself as creative and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rolls of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria T. is from Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Apolinaria is married and has three adult children. Apolinaria owns and operates a business making and selling foods in the local community. She is just starting this business.  She also manages a sari-sari store, which sells snacks and a variety of other products.

In July 2009, Apolinaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Apolinaria has successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC. She is now requesting a second loan, this one for 10,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase food for sale & additional stocks for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food products for sale & for additional stocks for her store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma C. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Alma owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Alma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton S. V. (pictured) was married a long time ago to Heng. They both are the good parents of two kids. Both of the kids are still young and attend the local primary school. Ton S. V. and her husband earn their daily income by cultivating rice and some vegetable crops, which they will sell when the crops mature. In addition to farming, they raise ducks to produce eggs and then sell. 

Ton S. V. wants to improve her duck-raising business, which is the most profitable one for family. She has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more feed and small ducks to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more feed and small ducks to breed

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden M. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at home and is requesting a loan to open a restaurant.  Kiden is 30 years old and a widow. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a restaurant

loans.name: Ana Cesilia

texts.es: Ana Cesilia tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la vetan de ropa, hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que son la parte más importantes en su vida. El negocio inicio hace aproximadamente 10 años, cuando decidió viajar a Managua a comprar mercadería y le dio muy buenos resultados pues le proporciono el alimento diario, es por eso que se ha interesado a mejorar sus ingresos con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Cesilia is 52 years old; she sells clothing. For more than 10 years, she has dedicated herself to this humble business. She is a woman who likes to work, and she has always liked to help her 3 children get ahead, since they are the most important part of her life. She started this business about 10 years ago when she decided to travel to Managua to buy merchandise, and she had such good results that she was able to provide her family's daily bread. That's why she is interested in increasing her income from this business. The loan she is requesting is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics. Her wish is to increase her business to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Celestino's Group

texts.en:
Celestino L. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 55 years old. Celestino is the group leader of a 18-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Celestino is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Celestino owns & operates a business venture into making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Celestino has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Celestino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celestino is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Celestino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly made up of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Italo es el presidente del grupo “LA BUENA AMISTAD” conformado por 13 socios,  amigos y compañeros D. trabajo en un mercado D. la zona, todos se dedican al comercio minorista y  con mucho esfuerzo tratan D. surgir cada uno en su negocio.
Italo es vendedor D. pan empezó en este negocio hace 15 años, al principio lo hizo como ayudante D. panadería fue un amigo que le dio la idea D. dedicarse a la venta D. pan por que se ganaba un poco mas.el empezó vendiendo pan en una canasta al principio le daba  vergüenza por que era muy joven pero su habilidad le ayudo a tener buenas ventas es así que el dueño D. la panadería le facilita un triciclo para que venda D. casa en casa,le fue tan bien que con el producto D. su trabajo pudo ahorrar y comprarse su propio triciclo actualmente venD. pan por su cuenta y reparte pan  por la zona D. los Olivos D. Pro, ahi es muy conocido y querido por sus clientes, por  otro lado también tiene un puesto D. venta D. abarrotes en el mercado esto le  genera otros ingresos,  su préstamo actual lo usara para pagar su cuenta en la panadería que le da crédito.  
En un futuro cercano Italo quiere tener su propia panadería el sueño del negocio propio sabe que lo lograra para eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo.

* Italo  aparece en la foto  con camisa blanca .
texts.en:
Italo is the president of the “LA BUENA AMISTAD” (Good Friendship) group maD. up of 13 members who are friends and co-workers in a local market. All are very small merchants and are trying, with a lot of effort, to succeed in each of their businesses.

Italo sells bread. He began this business 15 years ago. At first, he maD. bread as an assistant in a bakery. A friend gave him the idea of selling bread because he could earn a little more. He began selling bread on an itinerant basis from a basket. At first, he was bashful because he was very young, but his ability helped him to have good sales; so the owner of the bakery provided him with a tricycle equipped to carry bread so that he could sell from door to door. He did so well with his work that he was able to save and purchase his own tricycle.

Currently he sells bread on his own and distributes it throughout the Olivos D. Pro zone. He is very well known there and well liked by his customers. He also has a stall in the market selling groceries. This generates additional income.

He will use the current loan for paying his bill at the bakery that supplies him bread on credit. In the near future, Italo wants to have his own bakery. He dreams of having his own business and knows he will achieve this dream because he works very hard.

Italo appears in the photo with a white shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying a bakery which supplies bread

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with a son. She is a farming entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, Kherson region. Katerina owns several greenhouses and grows versatile farming produce for retail sale. She grows corn, peppers, cabbage, and squash. Katerina is very responsible and disciplined. She started this venture 3 years ago. Her diligence and natural composure have helped her succeed in this business. 

Katerina has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this venture. Her income is about 30,000 – 33,000 Grivnyas a month. Katerina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase drip irrigation units for her greenhouses as well as some fertilizers and peat. Besides greenhouses, Katerina also owns a cow and breeds rabbits.

loans.use: to purchase drip irrigation units and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of  Camp Phillips Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane makes and sells food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities. Mary Jane's husband contributes to the family's income by providing motorcycle transport to passengers from their village (photo taken with her husband's motorcycle).

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. GRACIELA, TIENE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES VIUDAD, TIENE UNA HIJA QUE ES MAYOR DE EDAD QUE VIVE CON ELLA. LA SRA. GRACIELA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "AMPLIACION VILLA EL POLVORIN" INTEGRADO POR 9 PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. 
DEBIDO A LAS NECESIDADES, EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR BRINDANDO SERVICIO DE LIMPIEZA EN CASA, CON LO CUAL PUEDE ASUMIR ALGUNOS DE SUS GASTOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES PONER UN RESTAURANT, PARA LO QUE HA SOLICITADO EL PRESTAMO.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela is 38 years old, widowed, and has an adult daughter who lives with her. She is part of the group “Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin”, which consists of nine individuals who live in the District of Carabayllo. To meet her needs, Graciela started providing housekeeping services in order to pay for some of her expenses.

Her next goal is to open a restaurant, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a restaurant

loans.name: Kyankyere Twetungure, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Through hustling and toiling, B. John, just 25 years old, has managed to invest in the timber sector for now close to three years. He was driven into this business by the fact that there is a lot of demand in the prevailing market, and this was after he left school since he could not easily get a job in his profession.

With a lot of work requiring timber, like furniture workshops and building and construction, John hopes to expand his business on getting this loan and open up supplying stores in different locations. This will enable him earn more revenue and be able to maintain a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To expand his business through marketing and opening up new locations

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 54 years old. Lucena is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lucena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Lucena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by owning and operating a general store and by selling frozen products. She lives in DSB, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental with her 55-year-old husband, Domingo, who works as a foreman in a construction firm. They have six children who are between 14 and 32 years old. Two of them are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and selling frozen products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Helen is now borrowing PHP 24,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is the wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She is an uneducated lady, who couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of her family. She owns a small house with two rooms in an area of Vehari known as Liaqat Park. 

Her husband operates a business selling medicines. He supplies medicines to different medical stores and to clinics as well. He has seven years of experience in this business.  

Ramzana also helps him financially by operating a domestic-sewing business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
She is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will be able to buy medicines in bulk and earn a good profit on them.

loans.use: Purchase medicines in bulk to resell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a welder. She has no formal education.

Ama sells foodstuffs in Elmina and has been in this trade for five years now. She uses her income to help her husband in taking care of the family. Ama will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs for sale and distribution.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to purchase more vegetables and foodstuffs for sale and distribution

loans.name: Surchase Group

texts.en: Patience S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Surchase Group. Patience is 28 years old, married and has two children aged two and 10. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling. For 5 years, she has been selling sausage in Waterside Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of sausage. She describes herself as very friendly woman. Her goal is to grow her business. In the photo, Rose A. is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of sausage

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Gabriela;  Ella tiene 27 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo;  se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia vende frutas en el mercado central, ella compra al por mayor del terminal de Quillabamba es una provincia de clima cálido y es llamada la ciudad del eterno verano, aquí existe muchas variedades de frutas ricas y a este paradero llegan muchos vendedores de frutas a comprar de los vendedores directos. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería de frutas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron de Santiago de Santiago community bank in the Santiago district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Her name is Sra. Gabriela. She is 27 years old, partnered and has one son. She operates a retail business, selling fruiits in the central market. She buys wholesale supplies of fruits in the market at Quillabamba, famous for its warm climate and known as the city of eternal summer. Many fruit-sellers go to the market because of the large variety of delicious fruits on offer and the many wholesalers who have businesses there. Sra. Gabriela will use the loan to stock her business. Sra. Gabriela is grateful for the loan and she is fully committed to repaying it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cases of olive oil.

loans.name: Concepción Valerio

texts.es:
Concepción Valerio B. F. vive en el municipio de Malambo y se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas desde hace mas de veinte años, cuando adquirió su experiencia en un restaurante en el que trabajó durante 5 años y cuando se retiró, con su liquidación emprendió su sueño de ser independiente en un sitio estratégico de Barranquilla. Concepción tiene 25 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con esta organización inició en la modalidad de grupos solidarios y después de su crédito número 22 se independizó. En la actualidad requiere su credikiva para comprar materias primas e insumos para sus comidas corrientes especialmente salsas y para adicionar mas sillas y herramientas porque tiene muchos mas clientes.

Desde que está vinculado a la Fundación ha tenido un buen comportamiento de crédito, su desafió mayor lo vivió con la construcción del transmetro, momento en el cual las ventas disminuyeron pero con la terminación de la obra logró recuperarse y aprovechó para experimentar en otro punto de ventas que en la actualidad como le ha dado buenos resultados se agrega a su crecimiento y quiere seguir fortaleciéndolo.

Porque este es su sueño para mejorar su vivienda, estar más cómodo con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 30 años, por eso se dispone a seguir persistiendo en el trabajo y continuar buscando bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción Valerio B. F. lives in Malambo and has sold prepared meals for over twenty years. He worked in a restaurant for five years and this is where he got the experience. When he retired he used his severance pay to follow his dream of being independent in some strategic location in Barranquilla. Concepción has had 25 loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He started out with the organization participating in group loans but after his 22nd loan he became independent. He needs a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and ingredients for his meal preparations, especially sauces. He also wants to add more chairs and work tools because he has many more customers. Since becoming associated with the Foundation he has had a very good credit history. His greatest challenge happened when the Metro Bus System was being built because sales dropped. Once construction was completed, though, he recovered and experimented with opening a second sales point which to date has had good results so he’d like to keep it and strengthen it. His dream is to continue improving his home so that he, his wife and three children, who are between the ages of 23 and 30, can be more comfortable. Therefore, he proposes to continue to persevere in his work and to continue to seek his family’s welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients for his daily meals especially sauces and to add more chairs and work tools because he has many more customers.

loans.name: Nilba

texts.es:
Nilba es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de un año de edad en el sector Colector del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace seis años, ella cuenta con siete vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para venderla a una empresa acopiadora que visita el lugar y que se las compra a 0.90 céntimos el litro. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como taxista no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

Adicionalmente, Nilba siembra forraje para sus animales en una pequeña extensión de terreno cercana al área donde vive. Actualmente ella desea adquirir alimentos balanceados y algunas medicinas para mejorar su alimentación y prevenir la presencia de futuras enfermedades en sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Nilba es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de lo que hace. Ella ya ha tenido préstamos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y también ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra muy agradecida porque siente que con esta ayuda puede seguir trabajando y sacando adelante a su negocio. En la imagen aparece junto a dos de sus vacas y a sus respectivos becerros, los cuales serán vendidos en algunos meses.
texts.en:
Nilba is 28 years old and a mother.  She lives with her husband and her 1 year old son in the Colector sector of the San José district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been farming for six years. She has seven cows which produce milk extracted and sold to a middle man company who visits this place and buys the milk at .90 cents a liter.  This business is very helpful for the support of her family, since what her husband earns as a driver is not sufficient to cover family expenses. 

In addition, Nilba plants fodder for their animals in a small plot of land near the area that they live. Currently she wants to buy feed and some medicines  to improve the animals' nutrition and prevent the occurrence of future diseases. Because of this she has decided to apply for a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Nilba is a hardworking woman who loves what she does.  She has had previous Edpyme Alternativa loans and also has had a loan funded by the Kiva Fund. She is very grateful because they feel that this support can help them continue working and advance the business.  In the picture she appears with two of their cows and calves, which will be sold in a few months.

loans.use: Expenditure on food and health of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy N. has been in the farming activity since the 2008 with good profit margin of Kshs 18,550 per month. She is married to Stephen Kuria and they have three children. They live in Gitaru, Kikuyu where she does the farming activity. Most of her customers are also residents of this village. Mercy takes some products to the nearby open air market.

She is applying for her second loan of Kshs 30,000 to buy animal feeds. With the anticipated profit she plans to grow the business and hopes to manage a large-scale milk supply.  Mercy desires to see her children realize their goals through better education in the future

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna R. is from the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Edna is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles & junk foods in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products for sale. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. S. is a housewife while her husband is a "tuk-tuk" driver, earning an income of about USD 15 per day. S. has to spend USD 25 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new "tuk-tuk" to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new "tuk-tuk" (motorbike with trailer)  to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa L. is from the village of Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Felisa is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Felisa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling charcoal in the local community. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Felisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Felisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget K., 36, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase duck eggs to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. K. and her husband purchase duck eggs to resell, earning an income of USD 12 per day. Khem is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples. The family spends USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy duck eggs to resell

loans.name: Reina Del Rocio

texts.es:
Reina Del Rocio  H. R. tiene 37 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos (Héctor Moreira, 20, Tamara Moreira, 17, y José Moreira, 15). Ella vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Reina del Rocio es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.  

Reina del Rocio tiene un comedor hace 9 años y ella solicitó el crédito para ampliar el negocio y para comprar pollos para criar y luego vender. Ella compra sus productos en Matilde Esther. Gracias al crédito ella podrá mejorar su servicio.

En este momento está alquilando una casa y su sueño es tener una casa propia donde puede tener su comedor. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta son pequeños problemas de salud y educación y una bajada de ventas en la época de vacaciones.

En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver televisión. Le gusta también asistir las fiestas del pueblo que se celebran cada 8 de diciembre y 22 de julio.
texts.en:
Reina del Rocio H. R. is 37, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children (Héctor Moreira is 20, Tamara Moreira 17 and José Moreira  15 years old). She lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

Reina del Rocio is a member of the rural communal bank Unidos Somos Más ("United We Are More"). This new branch belongs to the community of Matilde Esther in the province of Guayas. This community is located 2 hours from the Chillanes office in the province of Bolívar. The group has 23 members who are busy in various activities, such as agriculture, livestock rearing, small restaurants and cafeterias.

Reina del Rocio has had a restaurant for 9 years. She applies for this loan to expand her business and to buy chicken to farm and sell. She will buy her supplies in Matilde Esther. Thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her service level.

At this moment she rents a house. Her dream is to own her house where she can have her restaurant. She has to overcome a few challenges: minor health problems, education, and a drop in sales during the holiday season.

In her spare time she likes to rest and watch television. She also likes to attend the popular festivities that are celebrated every year on December 8 and July 22.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy chicken to farm and sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old married man, father of three boys, Mahmoud 10 years old, Jamal 9 years old and Abdullah one month old, living and working in Saida. Ali has owned a laboratory in Saida for 14 years; his work is good but the main problem he's facing is the unsolved issue of electricity. His work is delayed because of this problem and he doesn't want to be late with his clients, as this might lead them to search for another laboratory in the future. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a generator necessary to speed up his business, which should lead to business improvement and increase in income. He aims to provide a good living for his three boys, in addition to high educational levels. He hopes he can open a wider and more professional lab in the future where he can add new examinations such as X-rays and 3D.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his laboratory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for his shop

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una viuda y tiene 71 años D. edad. Tiene un hijo quien ya es independiente. Vive en su casa propia en la zona rural del caserío D. San Pablo Hualtaco II en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

DesD. hace seis años, se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva nueces, plantas y frutas como limón. Tiene un pequeño terreno agrícola situado cerca D. su domicilio. VenD. sus productos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Aprendió esta actividad D. su difunto esposo, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro.

Desea usar su crédito para comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento D. su cultivo D. limón. Ella espera poder mejorar su producción y la calidad del producto. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 500 nuevos soles. 

Elva es muy trabajadora. Se siente muy contenta por la confianza que los prestamistas D. Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa depositan en ella y por la ayuda que le brindan para mejorar su vida poco a poco.
texts.en:
Elva, 71 years old, is a widow.  She has a son, who is independent.  She lives in her own house in the rural area of the hamlet of San Pablo Hualtaco II, in the TambogranD. district.  This is an agricultural area located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has farmed for the last six years. She grows walnuts, plants, and fruits such as lemons.  She has a small plot of farmland located near her house.  She sells her products to the merchants who visit the area.  She learned this activity from her deceased husband, which is to say she knows farming insiD. out.

She would like to use her loan to buy fertilizers to maintain her lemon crop.  She hopes to be able to improve her production and the quality of the product.  To achieve her goal, she decided to solicit a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles.

Elva is very hardworking.  She is very happy about the confidence Kiva lenders and Edpyme Alternativa have in her, and for the help they give her to improve her life bit by bit.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 43 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 4 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El rostro serio de está trabajadora mujer, denota su constante lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde las primeras horas del día como hace 10 años, se dirige a cuidar sus cultivos de café y naranja, los cuales le proporcionan buenas ganancias en las negociaciones que realiza a los intermediarios que visitan sus 3 hectáreas, en cada cosecha. Paralelo a esta actividad, ella realiza jornadas de trabajo, en cultivos de sus vecinos; quienes le pagan un dinero extra por su trabajo. Ahora está planeando sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues requiere de mayor capital. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura podrá alcanzar sus objetivos. Manuela, está pensando utilizar el crédito en arreglar el auto que tiene, para incursionar en el trasporte público cubriendo las rutas Kivinaki-Cerro Picaflor.
texts.en:
Manuela, age 43, is a valiant single mother who cares for her four children with much love and affection. She lives in her own home in the native community of Kivinaki in the central Peruvian jungle. The serious demeanor of this hardworking woman indicates the constant struggle she faces to move her children forward. For the past ten years, Manuela has been caring for her coffee and orange crops each day beginning in the early morning hours. These crops have resulted in good earnings as a result of her negotiations with the intermediaries who visit her three hectares of land during the harvest season. In addition to her own farm, Manuela works as a laborer in cultivating the crops of her neighbors who pay her extra money for her work. Now she plans to grow her crops in greater quantities, but she needs more capital.

Manuela is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Almendra” (Almond Blossom). This is her first loan with MFP. She is confident that her group can accomplish its objectives. Manuela will use her loan to repair her automobile since she plans to enter the public transportation sector by offering services along the routes betweeen Kivinaki and Cerro Picaflor.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle repairs so that she can start providing transportation services

loans.name: Amagalan

texts.en: Amagalan S. is 62 years old, married, and has one child.  They live in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife is retired and stays at home.  His son attends college and drives a taxi in order to help his parents. Amgalan learned to make woodcraft items in 1967. He began operating a wood product-making business at home in 1990. He makes custom-ordered wooden furniture. He has a workshop which he purchased with his business revenues and is located in a crowded market. He currently operates his workshop and his business has become more stable. He supports his family and pays the tuition fees of his son with his income. Amgalan is teaching carpentry techniques to his son because he is planning to open a small factory of wood products in the future.  He is a hardworking person. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more wood and necessary materials for his woodcraft business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and other necessary materials

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S. has been in the farming business for a long time in Prey Chhor commune, in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband always use their own farmland in planting rice crops only and earn a profit of approximately 7 USD per day to support the entire family. The couple is blessed with  seven single children, two of whom are able to make an income by cutting down villagers' banana trees when they are mature and no longer produce. The other five are still studying in the local school. 

In order to improve their standard of living, this family has decided to ask for their first loan from Kiva to rent their neighbor's farm so as to expand their crop-growing business, to hire a few domestic laborers for plowing the farmland, and to buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop.

loans.use: To rent their neighbor's farm,  hire a few domestic laborers for plowing, and to buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La señora Marta vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene una casa propia, y vive con dignidad aunque no posee muchas comodidades, sólo las básicas.
Ella se dedica a la venta de víveres en general en su pequeña despensa, la cual se encuentra en la misma localidad que su hogar.
Se dedica a este negocio desde hace muchos años, le genera buenos ingresos, lo necesario como para vivir sin necesidades extremas, pero la vida es dura dice ella y trata de esmerarse cada día más para aumentar su clientela y la calidad de sus productos, por ello solicita el crédito, para invertir en la compra de víveres, panificados y bebidas en mayor cantidad y mejor calidad, de modo que obtenga su meta, la cual es mejorar su reconocimiento de servicio en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Marta lives in the city of Pilar.  She owns her house and lives with dignity despite having only the basics.  She sells groceries in general in her small store located in the same location as her home.

She’s been in business for many years and it generates her own income which is enough to live as long as need isn’t extreme.  But life is hard and she tries hard every day to increase her customer base and the quality of her products.  This is why she’s asking for a loan in order to buy groceries, baked goods and beverages in larger amounts and better quality to reach her goal which is to improve her service profile in the community.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, beverages and groceries in general.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias O. O. is twenty six years old and married. His wife stays at home to take care of their three-year-old daughter and Tobias goes out to run their manufacturing business called Two in One. Tobias makes cone feeders, feeding troughs, watering cans and other metal products to sell to local community members. His business is located in a busy market opposite a highway where there are many metalwork businesses and he is served by the Nairobi Central branch. Tobias has run his business for the past four years and is able to employ two people. Two in One is profitable but his major business challenge is financial constraints.

Tobias describes himself as courageous and dedicated and he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy sheets of iron to make feeders to expand his business and meet the growing demands of his customers.  In the future, Tobias hopes to grow his business, open other outlets, and become a millionaire. He also hopes to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy sheets of iron

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is a 36-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are 6 and 9 years old. Both of their children are in school.

To earn a living, Delphine owns a general store, where she sells food items such as beans, rice, and coffee. She runs this business with her husband, and she explains that they have operated the business for 12 years. She is now requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs, including beans and coffee. With the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she would like to renovate her family's house.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items, including beans and coffee.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is married and has two children.  He grows wheat and raises cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs, which would allow him to expand his farming and increase the number of animals. His goal is to work hard to support his family and above all to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza de 60 años es madre de familia vive en casa de unos familiares, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Esperanza vive en la provincia de Chiclayo. En la cual los pobladores desarrollan la actividad comercial, agrícola y turismo.

Esperanza se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco en su puesto en el mercado Modelo ( mercado popular con mayor afluencia en la zona de Chiclayo), desde hace varios  años, los martes y viernes son los días que más concurrencia de gente hay en el mercado y su producto se vende rápido. La venta de sus productos la ayudan a solventar sus gastos diarios del hogar.

Esperanza ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más pescado fresco y una congeladora para conservar este producto, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Esperanza desea que su negocio crezca cada vez más para tener mayores comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a mother who is 60 years of age. She lives at the home of some relatives. Her children are adults and live independently. Esperanza resides in Chiclayo Province, where the residents engage in developed businesses involving trade, agriculture, and tourism.

Esperanza buys and sells fresh fish from her own stand at the Modelo Market (the busiest and most popular market in Chiclayo). She has worked there for several years. Tuesdays and Fridays are her busiest days because there are plenty of people at the market and her product sells quickly during those times. The sale of her products helps her to cover her daily household expenses.

Esperanza is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more fresh fish and a freezer for preserving her product. This will allow her to increase her income so that she can repay her loan and improve her quality of life. Esperanza wants her business to grow each time so that she can acquire more comforts for her home.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and a freezer.

loans.name: Yawoa Mawunya

texts.fr:
Yawoa Mawunya est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant.
Yawoa Maurinya a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vende de pure water et quelques produits d'alimentation générale(sucre, riz, tomate) à son domicile.
Yawoa Maurinya a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 100 sachets de pure water, 200 unités de détergents, 2 bidons d'huile de palme, 48 unités de savons, 2 paquets de cubes et 4 sacs de riz.
texts.en: Yawoa Mawunya is a 32-year-old woman. She is unmarried and has one child. She has been working as a retailer since 2009. She sells Pure Water and a few grocery items (sugar, rice, tomatoes) out of her house. Yawoa Mawunya has requested her first loan with WAGES in order to buy 100 pouches of Pure Water, 200 units of detergent, 2 containers of palm oil, 48 units of soap, 2 packets of bouillon cubes, and 4 sacks of rice.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 36 years old and the single mother of five school-going children. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting.  She will sell her produce to the local market, as she is only practicing small scale farming. 

In future, Milka hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is a housewife. Her husband is a chief of construction workers with $10 per day for his income. She has two children who are 11 and 6 years old.  Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on transportation, $7 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her sister to use to travel to work. Before, she was a food seller but she quit because she was busy helping to cook for her husband’s workers at home. She plans to sell food again when she is free from helping her husband so that she can make additional income to help her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her sister to travel to work

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick was born in 1949. He is married and blessed with four children who are in school. Erick runs a cyber café to earn a living.  He has engaged in the business for five years and has employed one person to assist him in his tasks.  Erick has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he used his previous loan to boost his business.

Erick has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy printing paper and a computer. He hopes to invest into other businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy printing paper and a computer

loans.name: Mercita

texts.en:
Mercita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children.  Mercita sells clothing products like t-shirts, blouses, underwear & ornamental decorations. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy clothing products to sell.  Mercita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mercita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 24-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband is a teacher by profession. She lives in a house in Masindi, Uganda. She has been selling cereals for two years now. With the income generated, she has been able to educate her children. Betty started her business with only 200,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) but it has grown and now has a capital of 1,000,000 UGX. Hardships she faces in the business include poor roads for transporting products from villages to her store. Her dream is to run a big food store. Betty needs the loan facility to buy groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Catalina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  13, 12 y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ayudante de construcción.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas, almohadas y edredones, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres o cuatro días de la semana, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Picaza ya que allá le salen más barata que en otros lados. Nos cuenta que recién tiene 8 meses en este negocio y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y almohadas. Lleva 15 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en todo este tiempo. 

Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The December 24th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts have received national and international recognition. The famous Panama hats are made in this place.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Francisca. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 13, 12, and 9). The two older children are in high school and the youngest attends elementary school. Her husband is a construction assistant.

Francisca is a homemaker who earns her own income and helps her husband with the household expenses by selling bed sheets, pillows, and bedspreads. Her sales are made by going door-to-door. Francisca works either three or four days a week. She sells her products on credit and then collects payment every 15 days. Francisca goes to buy her merchandise at Picaza because the prices are much lower than any other places. She says that she recently started her business eight months ago and is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy bed sheets, bedspreads, and pillows. Francisca has participated in 15 loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys the assistance that has been given to her this entire time. Her dream is to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, bedspreads, and pillows.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children; three attend school, and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other restaurant operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business to make more profits in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Edgar Rene

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Rene es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de bachiller, se dedica actualmente a la carpintería, inició  siendo trabajador y lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para usarlos para capital de trabajo y producirá mas muebles, ya que esta vez va a compra madera, y mejorar así sus ganancias. Espera mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
25-year old Señor Edgar Rene is single. He graduated from high school and is now a carpenter. He started out as a assistant and has four years of experience.

Edgar is seeking a loan to invest in his business so he can produce more furniture and earn more money. He plans to buy wood with the money. He is hoping to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres  hijos.  La señora cuenta con educación superior.
Es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de servicio de orquesta y alquiler de equipos, con este dinero comprará  parlantes. 
La señora trabaja junto con su esposo en la orquesta.  Paralelamente y en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.
 La señora desea tener más equipos y ampliar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the 'Bellavista' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She completed her higher education.

Yaneth is a new client who recently started working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting a loan for 500 soles to invest in her business which is providing a band service and hiring equipment.  She will use this money to buy speakers.

Yaneth works alongside her husband in the band.  In parallel with this, and in her free time, she sells beauty products through a catalog.  She would like to have more equipment and expand her business.

What Yaneth likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy speakers

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has been running a greenhouse, planting different kinds of fruits for the past six years and earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is 44 years old and married with four children who are still schooling. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff. She applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy tomato and green pepper seeds for the green house  farming 

Evaline hopes to make a profit and reinvest in other businesses that can generate more income. Her dream is to see her children prosper in life. She is a hardworking woman who can do better if funded.

loans.use: to buy tomato and green pepper seeds for the green house  farming

loans.name: Las Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas Triunfaremos lo conforman María del Carmen, Ileana Francisca y Andrea, tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María del Carmen de 45 años quien desde hace 15 años tiene una fritanga con lo cual saco adelante a sus 8 hijos.
Mientras Ileana Francisca de dedica a la compra de chatarra para reciclaje y Andrea comercializa ropa usada desde hace 3 años.
texts.en: The group Unidas Triunfaremos consists of María del Carmen, Ileana Francisca and Andrea, 3 hardworking and enterprising women. The group coordinator is Señora María del Carmen who is 45 years old who has run a fried snack place for the last 15 years with which she raised her 8 children. Meanwhile Ileana Francisca buys scrap metal for recycling and Andrea has been selling used clothing for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, meat, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a widow with three children. Sergio is 56 years old and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Sergio owns farm land, on which he plants, harvests and sells rice to earn a living.  He has been 6 years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP6,200 doing this type of business. 

Sergio requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Sergio is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Sergio wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, chompas, blusas y otras ropas más. 

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones y chompas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The client continues participating in Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank, of the microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues working selling clothing such as, for example, pants, sweaters, blouses, and other clothes.

The previous loan went very well for her and she managed to get good profits.  For this reason she wants another loan since it helps her a lot.

The client requires the loan to buy merchandise such as pants and sweaters.

She is grateful for the opportunity this loan offers and so she is committed to making the payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants and sweaters.

loans.name: Adonias Group

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Sarah from Machipisa, Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married and has one child. She also cares for three dependents. 

Sarah runs a clothing business. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges she faces are the duty charges at the border post. 

Sarah has requested a loan of $400 to pay for duty and bus fare. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her living conditions as she is renting a one-room at present. In the future, Sarah plans to have a big space for selling her wares.

loans.use: to buy clothes from across the borders for resale.

loans.name: Sierra Lee

texts.en:
Sierra Lee is 27 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor Province. She is a single mother of two children. Sierra Lee raises pigs for a living, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,500. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to use as capital for her business.

Sierra Lee has been a member of Pagalaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Sierra Lee hopes to have savings for her two children's future education.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, medicines and farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old, a single mother of one child aged two years.  She has been selling tomatoes for the past year with a monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, kales and onions for her business.  With the anticipated profit from the business she will add different fruits. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kales and onions for her business.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Justine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justine est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Eric. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Justine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Justine vend depuis quatre ans de l’huile de palme, des poulets et des noix de palme de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Justine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mahugnon group is made up of three people who live in the same area. It is the fourth time that this group has requested financial help from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Justine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Justine is 33 years old and married to a builder called Eric. She did not go to school. The couple has three children who are all at school and in their care. Justine lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the various household expenses. In order to contribute to her family's various needs, Justine has for the past four years been selling palm oil, chicken and palm nuts on a door-to-door basis. This activity enables her to provide for her needs without difficulty. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase both her turnover and income, Justine is, together with the other members of the Mahugnon group, a fourth loan from Alidé. The first three loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy containers of palm oil and chickens

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace used to sell waakye (beans and rice mixed together), but she recently opened a cosmetics store at Dompoase, near Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees, and her husband pays for other household expenses. Her loan will be used to expand her store. Grace hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 39, is a mother of three children, aged 2 and 13. She is married and lives at West Point. Grace stopped her education in the seventh grade. 

She has a table in the market, where she has been selling raw fish for the past ten years. Her husband works in the government sector, and gave her the initial capital to start in the business. Her favorite part of her business is how customers respond to the business. She makes a profit when she sells; with the profit she buys more goods for the business to increase her sales. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business. Her future plan is to build house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish for the business.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge résidant à Adidogomè. Agée de 51 Kossiwa est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Kossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de culottes et de tricots en vue de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.

loans.use: Acheter 200 unités de colottes et 250 unités de tricots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sophia would like to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.en:
I have been selling children's, women's, and men's clothes for 3 years now. I like doing it because I get to meet new people. My clients order what they need, and I deliver it to them. I think my business is profitable and stable because I try to sell my products in response to clients' orders. My sells will improve if I am able to secure capital to invest and buy a greater variety of clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Me dedico a la venta de ropa para niño, dama y caballero, este negocio lo tengo desde hace tres años. y me gusta ya que he podido conocer otras personas. Mis clientes me piden lo que necesitan y se los entrego, considero que mi negocio es rentable y fijo ya que trato que sea mediante pedidos. Mis ventas mejoraran mas si puedo obtener capital para invertir y poder comprar ropa variada.

loans.use: To buy children's, women's, and men's clothes

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a widow and a mother of one child. Her husband died leaving nothing behind and she was the only one left to take care of her son and her self. Motivated by the activities of other GHAPE members in her community, she joined the organization and received her first loan of $40 in 2005. From her previous loans, she has been providing ready food to manual laborers and hawkers in her community and equally to school children. The profit she got from the business was used in meeting up with the demands of her child in school and equally for medication when he fell sick. 

Rachael has successfully received and repaid loans for the past two years and given a loan of $500, she plans to buy four bags of Koki beans and seven tins of palm oil for increased production.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: sale of accra beans, Koki, Koki beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Sarorn is a widow with 7 children. She has been in the business of planting vegetables on her plot of land in the village for more than 20 years. All of her children are under her guardianship. However, most of them have been working at the garment factory for almost 5 years. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA three times. The current loan amount is $700. She will use this loan to prepare the land, and purchase fertilizer to plant vegetables. She will also use the rest of the amount to repair the house. There will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Preparing the land, purchase fertilizer to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Yazmin Alejandra

texts.es:
Yazmin is an enterprising single woman with high hopes of moving ahead in life. She started her business because she had no other means of paying for her education. Her mother helps her make and sell corn tortillas, and part of the money goes to helping her parents with household expenses as well as her education. She started two years ago after helping her mother make tortillas at home and decided to turn it into a business. Little by little, she has become better known and has taken on more customers.

Yazmin is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase ingredients to make the tortillas as well as a new stove to increase production. She plans to repay the loan within five months. She is very grateful for your support in helping her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
