Florence has owned a beauty salon for one year. To help expand her business, Florence is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, a Kiva partner. The loan will be used to buy more materials for the beauty salon. Florence hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to expand her business. In the future, Florence hopes to pay school fees for her child and help her family. About BRAC Uganda: This loan is administered by BRAC Uganda, a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in Uganda that is also a part of the BRAC international network. BRAC Uganda attempts to address poverty through a holistic model, offering programs in education, health, water and sanitation, agriculture, and microfinance. BRAC Uganda’s microfinance program aims to provide the poor with easy, reliable and efficient access to institutional financial services, and reaches over 150,000 families in Uganda. For more on BRAC Uganda, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/65, and join our lending team, Friends of BRAC Uganda, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_brac_uganda

loans.use: To add more materials for the beauty salon

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Aïssata D. à droite de la photo portant des lunettes de soleil est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un commerce de draps de lit, de rideaux, d’arachides et de bracelets pour enfants. 

Son prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin d’accroître ses bénéfices

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group MANKO came into being six months ago. It is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They also all belong to the same "Banc Villageois" SANTHIABA COKI2. Mrs. Aïssatou D., on the right in the photo, wearing sunglasses, is the group leader. She is 56, married and the mother of one child. She is also raising two other children who were confided to her care by relatives. She sells sheets, curtains, peanuts (groundnuts) and bracelets for children. Her loan will allow her to bolster her stock so that she can make more profit. Her goal is to help her husband with the expenses of supporting their family and at the same time, put aside more savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Further develop and advertize her business

loans.name: 1 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Cascada  es uno de los doce centros focales que se encuentran en la ciudad de El Alto. Al mismo ha ingresado la asociación comunal de “1 de Marzo”, este grupo consta de ocho socias y está iniciando su segundo ciclo a la cabeza se encuentra la señora Lucy como presidenta.

La  señora Lucy refiere que es su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución.  Su negocio es el macramé, su crédito inicial fue de Bs.500.- y le sirvió para la compra de flecos para las mantas, actualmente está haciendo una solicitud de Bs.300.- con el mismo objetivo. Este trabajo le permite cuidar su hogar, pues lo realiza en su mismo domicilio y la venta es segura, por que sólo trabaja a pedido de sus clientes.  Con respecto a los servicios de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta el Consultorio de Salud y su capacitación, por el trato del personal.

La base de la A.C. “1 de Marzo” también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, tejido de mantas y gorras, venta de chinelas, artesanía Tejido de Alpaca, trenzado de mantas, venta de mantas.
texts.en:
The Cascada Focal Center is one of the 12 focal centers in the city of El Alto. The “1 de Marzo” communal bank has joined it. This group has 8 members and is starting its 2nd cycle led by group president, Lucy. Lucy tells us that this is her 2nd cycle in our institution. Her business is macramé. Her initial loan was for Bs.500 and she used it to buy fringes for the blankets. She is currently requesting Bs.300 for the same purpose. This work allows her to care for her home because she does it there and the sales are a sure thing because she only works based on prior orders from her customers. With respect to Pro Mujer services, she states that she likes the Health Center and the training because of the personal attention. Other “1 de Marzo” communal bank members have their own businesses. Among them are: sweater knitting, blanket weaving, blanket and cap weaving, slipper sales, handicrafts, Alpaca woolens, blanket braiding, blanket sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fringe.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es:
El señor Filemón H. M. tiene 34 años convive con la Señora Simona Flores Villarroel más de  12 años, tienen 2 hijos menores dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, en la escuela rural de la comunidad, la actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, oca, haba en el terreno que tiene 2 hectáreas sector Cotani Bajo Sector Churo, son una familia humilde de pocos recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 45 km de la ciudad de Cbba para ellos  acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.  

El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Donde Don Filemón H. M. necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico, semilla de papa para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola, Filemón nos comenta que la producción agrícola ha sido poco por factores climáticos como la sequia, si este año no siembra no tendría alimentación ni dinero tampoco ahorro para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Filemón H. M., 34, has lived together with Mrs. Simona Flores Villarroel for over 12 years. They have two minor, dependent children who are in primary school at the rural school in the community. His main activity is potato, oca (an Andean tuber) and lima bean farming on a 2 hectare field in Cotani Bajo, Sector Churo. They are a humble family of few resources but are very hard working. They are located 45 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba and it is very difficult for them to come to the banks to request loans. CIDRE took the initiative to go to this rural zone where Mr. Filemón H. M. needed money to buy organic manure and potato seed for the next planting season. Filemón mentioned to us that production has been poor due to climactic factors, mainly the drought. If he doesn’t plant this year he won’t have food or money to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es: Carlota del Carmen se dedica es la venta de refrescos. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio es en las afueras de un dispensario, en donde las enfermeras, doctores, pacientes entre otras personas. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ha sido muy importante ya que es el trabajo que realiza todos los días para mantener a su familia. Este crédito lo realiza para comprar gaseosas, hielo, bolsas plásticas, jugos y frutas.
texts.en:
Carlota del Carmen sells refreshments. She has collaborated with the Foundation for a long time because it’s been a big help. Her business is located outside a dispensary where the nurses, doctors and patients, among others are her customers. She has been in business for over 8 years because it’s been very important in that it is the work she does daily to support her family. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, ice, plastic bags, juices and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, ice, plastic bags, juices and fruit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 31-year-old woman, married with four children aged 12, 8, 6, and 1. She cares for her family and lives in her own permanent house. Her family goal is to educate her children. Her home address is Masindi, Uganda. 

She is into the poultry business and has been doing it for two years now. She started with a few chicks but now has many and the challenge she faces is that chicken feed is expensive. In future she wishes to expand her business to supply both broilers and layers. She needs the loan to buy more chicks.

loans.use: Buy more chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul K., the leader of the group, is 55, married, and has three children. Her daughter is married and both of her sons work as loaders in a private organization. The main family income is derived from cattle breeding and milk selling, earnings from which have made possible the building of a house and the purchase of a car. Nurgul will use the loan to purchase a cow, and in the future she wants to arrange a son’s wedding and open a shop.

Munar B., a 59-year-old widow with five children, earns money by cattle breeding and milk selling. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase a washing-machine.

Maksat N., 37, is married and has three sons. He will use his part of the loan to obtain a cow for breeding.

Gulbubu J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 56, married, and has six children. The family earns its livelihood by cattle breeding, milk selling and farming. The loan's purpose is to buy milk cows.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa S. is a 67-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating  threembusiness ventures:  Piggery, Rice Grinding and Furniture Sales businesses.She lives in Humayan, Brgy. Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 7 years now and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Piggery, Rice Grinding and Furniture Sales businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,500. Ninfa is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she  can  fund her business operations.   This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Ninfa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of her piggery

loans.name: Shu's Group

texts.en:
The group for this loan consists of four people. They are located in Preaek Ta Pov village, Kandal province.  This group selected Mrs. Shu M., a 30 year old, married woman, as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Shu M. earns her living by selling fish in the market. Since her fish selling is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to help expand her business. Her husband, Mr. Thab Saly, is 32 years old and works as a construction worker. With their businesses, they are able to earn some income to support their three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more fish to expand the business

loans.name: Ashignov

texts.en: Ashignov N. is 61-year-old single parent with one adult daughter. He and his daughter live together in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Hovd Province in Western Mongolia. His only daughter, age 19, attends university. Ashignov operates a coal-selling business in his town.  He purchases coal directly from local mines and uses his large Russian truck to transport it back to his town. Since 1985, he has been driving a big truck and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. He hopes to purchase a larger truck in the future. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to make necessary repairs to his truck to transport more coal.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his truck

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 33 years-old and is married with three children aged between four and 17 years-old.  He also takes care of one orphan who is 14 years-old. Denis has eight years experience selling seeds for Irish potatoes. He employs four people and his business is open from 7am until 4pm every day except on Saturday. 

Denis has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company to purchase more equipment and other stock.  He would like to own a small shop one day if he can make enough profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for a farm seedling business.

loans.name: Adrian Bladimir

texts.es:
Adrian Bladimir S. S. tiene 21 años y vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Adrian Bladimir es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Adrian Bladimir tiene un soda bar. El abrió su negocio hace 3 años. El compra sus productos en Matilde Esther. Con este crédito Adrian Bladimir desea ampliar su negocio de soda bar y poner comidas rápidas. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar el servicio. 

Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia y un negocio propio ya que ahora vive arrendando. Los desafíos que el enfrenta en su negocio son algunos problemas económicos y la bajada de ventas en invierno. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar indoor y descansar. También disfruta la fiesta del pueblo cada 8 de diciembre.
texts.en:
Adrian Bladimir S. S. is 21 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Adrian Bladimir is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new loan group is located in Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office, in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in a number of different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Adrian Bladimir has a soda bar.  He opened his business 3 years ago.  He buys his products in Matilde Esther.  Adrian Bladimir will use this loan to expand his business and to start serving fast food.  The loan will help him to improve his service.  His goal for the future is to own his own home and business as he is currently renting.  The challenges that he faces in his business are financial problems and the fall in sales over the winter.  In his spare time he likes to play indoor soccer and relax.  He also enjoys celebrating the local fiesta every 8th of December.

loans.use: To support his soda bar business and to start selling fast food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has six children. To make a living, Virginia grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes from rice farming rice. Virginia and her husband are also involved in fishing. She sells her husband's catch to their community.

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to buy farming supplies and fishing gear. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fishing gear

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, de 35 años, vive al lado de su esposa Dora (35) y de sus tres hijos menores de edad, juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante. 

Desde hace un año este trabajador hombre instaló en una pieza de su vivienda un pequeño negocio de venta de suministros para construcción (como tubos, pegamentos, herramientas de acero, entre otros), en esta ferretería trabaja al lado de su familia, pues cuando él no puede atender le ayudan sus hijos o su esposa. Dice que obtiene regulares ganancias que invierte en surtir mejor su negocio y le brinda una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Además paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su auto propio en una ruta cercana a su zona. Esta muy satisfecho pues tiene buenas ganancias lo que le permite pagar una buena escuela a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de suministros para el hogar pues por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia. 

Efraín tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de artículos que necesita para surtir mejor su ferretería, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y así seguir progresando. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Efrain is 35 years old and lives with his wife Dora, age 35, and their three young children. Each day they strive to get ahead.

A year ago, this hardworking gentleman set up a small business on his property where he sells construction supplies (such as tubes, adhesives, steel tools, and other items). His family works with him. His children and wife manage their hardware store whenever he is not present. Efrain says that he is able to generate steady income by keeping his business well-stocked. This allows him to provide his family with a good quality of life. In addition, he provides transportation services by driving his own car along a route near his district. He is very satisfied because his income enables him to pay for his children to attend a good school. In the future, he wants to expand his home improvement store because there is no other competition in the district.

Efrain plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of items needed to restock his hardware store. He hopes to improve his profits so that he can continue progressing.

This is his first loan with MFP. Efrain promises to complete his payments on time because he does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible for making this loan possible so that he could continue working and moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to sell in his hardware store

loans.name: Kamene Katuu

texts.en:
Kamene Katuu is 48 years old and married to Nicholas Kimanji. She supports eight members of her family. She sells fruits and vegetables as a primary business, and at the same time she practices crop farming. She has been operating these two businesses for a period of two years with an income of about $150 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to buy a variety of vegetable seedlings for planting and ready bananas to sell. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetable seedlings and ready bananas, cabbages and fruits to sell

loans.name: Kanoni Tweyambe Group A-Kihihi

texts.en:
Twenty-eight year old Annet A. is a tea farmer who operates from Kayonza in Kihihi district, Uganda. Annet, like many other enterprising young women in Uganda, has been striving to be an exception to the stereotype that women cannot be in charge of their destinies.

Annet, who is happily married with 6 kids, has been engaged in overseeing a tea production and sales business for the last 7 years. Through the course of these years, she has been making her own decisions on how to run her business without any help. Tea is among the highest selling cash crops in Uganda, and Annet says she has never regretted the decision she took to begin this business. At her farm, she does not just grow tea but also bananas that she also sells after harvesting.

Monthly, she says this business generates her shillings 260,000, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase fertilizers and manure to improve her yields and the fertility of her tea farm. Annet belongs to Kanoni Tweyambe group-Kihihi.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure to improve production and fertility of her tea farming gardens.

loans.name: Sairanbi

texts.en:
K. Sairanbi lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is widow and has two clever daughters, one of them works at home taking care of her family. Sairanbi sells woman’s shoes in the market of Pandjer in Dushanbe region. She started her business with her own capital and has been in this business for 7 years.  

Sairanbi would like to get a loan of 11500 Somoni to stock up on new fashionable shoes and expand her business.  She thanks all lenders who support her and her family, which allows her and her family to live better. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock new shoes for her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Irene has been engaged in her business for more than 7 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Irene is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Irene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is 29 years old and is married. She has two children aged five and three. Her husband works as a farmer.
Annelyn is engaged in farming. She has been assisting her husband in growing rice and corn for five years. They earn 5,000 PHP from farming. Annelyn also manages a sari-sari store. She sells items such as canned goods and noodles. She plans to use her loan to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell at her store. In the future, Annelyn hopes to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, a 37-year-old married father of two children, has run a cafeteria for almost four years to earn a living.  He employs three people to assist him in the business. Joshua also operates a retail shop and a tailoring business to supplement his income, and he previously also sold milk.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joshua has improved both his business and his living standards and is now requesting a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy beans, sugar, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat to stock in his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Bayansaikhan

texts.en:
Bayansaikhan is a 40-year-old widow and lives with her two sons and two daughters, aged between 1 and 21. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in an apartment. Bayansaikhan's oldest son works as a dancer in the countryside while her youngest son and oldest daughter attend public school. Bayansaikhan’s mother is retired and cares for Bayansaikhan’s youngest daughter. 

Bayansaikhan supports her children by operating two retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2000, she sold TV antennas at her one stall. Today she sells TV antennas and telecontrols at her two retail stalls and she has 3’000’000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She said: “I want to support my children's education and their lives by working hard”. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more TV antennas and telecontrols from Ereen, the border city of China, so that she can sell more to her customers during this very busy shopping season.

loans.use: to purchase more TV antennas and telecontrols

loans.name: Oulara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 juin 2011. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Henriette qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de citron et de savon en poudre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital afin de faire la promotion de son activité.

Les profits lui permettront de participer à l’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on June 7, 2011.  It is made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their primary business is petty trading.  Madam Henriette, who is at the right of the photograph, raising her hand, is the group leader.  She is 36 years old.  She is a widow and the mother of three children.  She sells lemons and powdered soap.  She has much valuable experience in the business, having practiced it for many years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital in order to promote her business.  The profits will allow her to participate in the improvement of her family's quality of life (health, nutrition, clothing, etc...).

loans.use: to buy lemons and powdered soap.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a sanitary officer. She trades in soft drinks as well as fries fish for sale (as seen in the picture above).  She has done this in Abura for 2 years. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children. Esi will use the loan to purchase additional fish to fry to meet the demands of her customers. As part of her future plans, she hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is an aggressive 25-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been running a cosmetics shop since 2002. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for making funds available to her. This has helped her to boost her business. In the next five years, she wants to have opened several business outlets. Her dream is to gain a wider market for her products.
Joan wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy cosmetics products and repaint her business premises.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and repaint her business premises.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; la socia tiene 35 años; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 18, 17 y 8 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende leche fresca, también queso que son los derivados de sus vacas lecheras, la socia tiene vacas lecheras y toros, ella cría las vacas las engorda y vende, al igual que vende los derivados de estas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 1 vaca ternera y 1 toro tierno para aumentar el número de sus ganados vacunos.

 La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the "Mujeres en Acción" community bank which is located in Compone district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Lucila is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 18, 17 and 8.  Her business is selling products retail.  She sells fresh milk and also cheese from her dairy cows.  She keeps dairy cows and bulls.  Lucila raises the cows, fattens them and sells them.  She also sells the dairy products she gets from them.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying 1 young cow and 1 young bull to increase the number of cattle she has.

Lucila is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy 1 calf (cow) and 1 calf (bull) to increase her number of cattle

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Manuel vive en la ciudad de Managua.
El señor carlosr  visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que piensa hacerles  mejoras a su vivienda.
La inversión que el  señor  va hacer es la compra de y cemento, piedra, arena, hierro, las mejoras que el señor va hacer es un cuarto de habitación .
 agradece mucho a ceprodel por que gracias al financiamiento va poder mejorar su vivienda y así también sus condiciones de vida para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Manuel lives in the city of Managua.

Señor Carlos visited our office to request a loan because he intends to make improvements to his home.

The investment that the Señor will make is in buying cement, stone, sand, and iron.  The home improvement that the Señor will make is a bedroom.

He is very grateful to Ceprodel as thanks to the funding, he will be able to improve his home and in this way also improve his living conditions, and those of his family.

loans.use: to make home improvements and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Bitcherose

texts.en:
Bitcherose is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bitcherose has a bakeshop where she sells breads, biscuits, pastries & cakes. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

Bitcherose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bitcherose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is very active and talented lady who performs her household duties very well. She also operates a clothes-sewing and boutique business to support her husband financially. She displays her dresses in her boutique which helps her attract more customers towards her work. 

She is the mother of six children; the first three work while her three younger children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He also operate a video shop through which he sells movies and DVDs. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her own business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine and some clothes that will allow her to make more dresses to display for selling and earn better profits. 

She is very confident that her business will go in a positive direction after making an investment into it. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shahida ".

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and clothes for sewing & boutique business

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy stays at home and does housework. Her husband is a pedicab driver. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two daughters; one is a garment worker, and the other stays at home.

The main source of income is from her daughter’s salary. She is asking for another loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Leonarda Migdalia

texts.es: Leonarda Migdalia tiene 41 años, ella se encuentra muy contenta con su medio de vida, pues le ha ayudado mucho para sacar a su familia adelante uno de sus mayores desafíos es que no puede comprar todos los productos que sus clientes le solicitan pues debido a que los precios de las utilidades varían. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar variedad en sus productos como es perfumes, cremas, ropa en general, sabanas, manteles, prendas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Leonarda Migdalia is 41 years old. She is very happy with her business, as it has helped her to provide for her family's future. 

One of her biggest challenges is that she is unable to buy all the products requested by her customers because the prices vary.

That's why she is requesting this loan to buy an assortment of products, such as perfumes, creams, sheets, tablecloths and clothing.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products, such as perfumes, creams, sheets, tablecloths and clothing.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió y propicio para la cría de ganado por sus amplias llanuras, su gente es muy amable, cálida y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 35 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 17, 14, 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y también  estudia en un colegio a distancia, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su tercer hijo está en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo labora en cualquier trabajo que le salga al día como albañil, pintor etc., no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

La Señora. María se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa en casa cría y vende  pollos, cuyes, vacas y borregos. También labora en la agricultura y lo que le produce es  solo para el consumo de su hogar. Como pasa en casa la mayor parte del tiempo se dedica a bordar, esta actividad  aprendió trabajando. 

Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas para el bordado y en alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio de venta de polleras (faldas).
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Libertad en Progreso” communal bank.  She lives in a community belonging to Victoria del Portete (Cuenca) Parish.  This is a cold climate place apt for raising livestock on its wide plains.  Its residents are kind, warm and keep the customs and traditions of their peoples.

María is 35 years old and has four children who are 17, 14, 5 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest son works and helps out economically while also studying at a distance high school.  Her second son is in secondary school and her third son is in Kindergarten.  Her husband works at whatever job comes up as a bricklayer, painter, etc.  She does not own a house but lives in a family member’s house.

She cares for her children and since she stays home she raises chickens, guinea pigs, cows and sheep to sell.  She also farms but what she grows is only for home consumption.  Since she spends most of her time at home she also embroiders, a skill she learned working.

She’s in her 8th loan with the communal bank and the new one will be invested in the purchase of fabric to embroider and to buy animal feed.  Her goal is to have a business selling ‘polleras’ (skirts).

loans.use: to buy fabric and animal feed.

loans.name: Alter

texts.en:
Alter, 46 years old, is married and has two children. He lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City. Alter provides motor transport services in his village, earning a monthly income of PHP 22,800. Alter has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase motorcycle repair materials.

Alter became a member of GDMPC this year. His plan for his and his family's future is to acquire another vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle repair materials

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 57 years old and married with six children. She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental. For the past 16 years, Anatalia has owned and operated a general store where she sells a variety of products to earn a living. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. Anatalia has been a member of GDMPC for more than four years.

Anatalia is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more products to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her credit and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Santa, tiene 45 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya  mayores y el ultimo  de 11 años que estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio y con esto contribuir de alguna forma  a sacar adelante a su familia, él se dedica a la venta de pescado, tres veces por semana  en la madrugada él se desplaza hasta las playas  para comprar el mejor pescado a pescadores que llegan hasta este lugar, luego de limpiarlos los envía a la ciudad de Quito lugar donde vive un hermano que es quien se encarga de vender allá. Llevan 8 años en este negocio y les ha ido bien  ya que cada día tienen más clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses y con esto se ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es comprar un camión para llevar el pescado en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo in the Montecristi Cantón, a city with a refreshing climate and many natural tourist attractions nearby, as well as home to famous straw hats.

In this place we meet Santa, who is 45 years old, and married with four children. Three of her children are grown, and the youngest is eleven years old and goes to school. Three of her children still live at home. Her husband is a merchant.

She is requesting the loan to help her husband with his business, and in this way contribute somehow to help their family get ahead. He sells fish. Three times a week, he goes down to the beach in the early morning to purchase the best fish from the fishermen who dock there. Later he cleans the fish and sends them to Quito, where his brother, who lives there, is in charge of selling them there. They have spent eight years running this business, and it has done well for them, especially since every day they have more customers.

This loan is for purchasing fish. Santa has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and she is happy because the loans are offered at very low interest rates, and this helps very much. Her dream is to purchase a truck to be able to transport a larger quantity of fish.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat, 30, is a teacher of driving. He has been doing his job for many years. He lives with his family in the house which is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His monthly salary does not meet with his family expenses and he always searches ways to raise his family income. His wife, Urangoo, has not been employed still and cares their children at home. 

She and Ganbat havw a plan to start a grocery store business to increase their income. It is a beneficial way to raise his family income in the future. Urangoo will run their grocery store and will sell the food commodities according their plan. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the food commodities for building the working capital of his new grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase the food commodities for building the working capital of his new grocery store.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa Iuopapa. She is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Pepe raises crops. Her  income comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Pepe has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 400 WST per month.

In 2011, Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from SPBD, in the amount of 1000 WST, to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Pepe plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, a 23-year-old married woman with two children, neither of whom is in school, has a business selling fish in Yei South Sudan.  In business for the past two years, Sina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish to sell. She will use the resulting extra income to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en: Sour, 58, is widowed and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a clay stove producer. She has been working in this field since 1982. Sour is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase flat metal to cover her clay stoves. In the future, she would like to expand her business by hiring more people to produce more stoves to sell.

loans.use: to purchase flat metal to cover her clay stoves

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana es socia del banco comunal Primero de Enero, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia El Valle en Cuenca, conocida también como San Bautista de El Valle, parroquia en la que se puede disfrutar de la paz de la naturaleza, su gente es amable y gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Diana tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 7 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que viven es  propiedad de familiares.
 
Doña Diana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y en su casa tiene una tienda de comestibles la cual atiende de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es tener casa propia y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of Primero de Enero Communal Bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the El Valle de Cuenca district, also known as San Bautista de El Valle, where you can enjoy the peace of nature.  The people there are pleasant and kind, and maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

Diana, 27, is married and has three children from this relationship, ages 8, 7, and 2.  Her first two children are going to a school in the city.  Her husband works in construction and the house in which they live is the property of relatives.

Diana works taking care of her home, and in her house she has a grocery store she sees to from Sunday through Sunday from 6 in the morning until 8 at night.

This is her first loan from the communal bank, to which she was invited by a neighbor.  She is going to invest her loan in buying basic household necessities to stock her store.

Her goal is to have her own house and to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est un jeune sénégalais âgé de 27 ans qui est établi dans le village de boundoum, il exerce cette activité de culture du riz de la variété sahel 108 depuis son enfance, avec ce prêt, il va acheter du semence de riz, d'engrais, d'herbicide et de carburant.

Il compte accroître sa surface de terre cultivable afin d'avoir un rendement abondant en fin de récolte, il veut également lutter pour une autosuffisance en riz dans son village natal en particulier et dans la vallée du fleuve Sénégal en général.

loans.use: Achat de semence de riz(variété sahel 108), d'engrais, d'herbicide et de carburant

loans.name: Claudia Valentina

texts.es: Claudia, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en una de las aldeas de Tela, Atlántida. Claudia realizaba trabajos de estilista para generar ingresos y hace dos años decidió por establecer una pulperia donde ofrece productos como golosinas, dulces, pastas, carne de pollo, refrescos, pan, lácteos, arroz, frijoles y otros abarrotes. Con este negocio recibe mas ingresos. Con el fin de surtir mas su negocio solicita la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras para comprar refrescos, carnes, pan y granos basicos para surtir y vender en esta temporada. Así podrá ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Su meta es poder fortalecer el negocio y  brindarle mejor educacion a sus hijos.

loans.use: Comprar refrescos, carnes, pan y granos basicos para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié in 1970, Akuwa K. is married and the mother of four children. After quitting school, she entered into a sewing apprenticeship. Her husband works in the same field as a tailor. But given the cost of living, people prefer second-hand clothing, and so there is less work for him, and thus he earns less. This situation obliges Ms. K. to commit more income to household expenses than her husband does. An honest and energetic woman, she has several apprentices in her shop, which is called «Main de Dieu», or Hand of God. She needs more machines to ensure that her apprentices are well-trained and to guarantee her shop’s good reputation.

To do this, Ms. K. is requesting a loan of $950 as capital to buy five sewing machines and also work-related materials. She will then be able to help improve the training and work environments for her apprentices, as well as to ensure the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Tsévié, Madame K. Akuwa est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, elle entre en apprentissage de couture. Son époux est également tailleur. Mais compte tenu du coût de la vie, les hommes préfèrent les friperies ce qui fait qu’il a moins de travail donc gagne moins. Cette situation oblige Madame K. à s’investir plus dans les charges du ménage que son mari. Honnête et dynamique, elle a plusieurs apprenties et a besoin d’augmenter le nombre de machines pour assurer une bonne formation des apprenties et garantir la bonne réputation de son atelier.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à l’achat de 5 machines à coudre et des matériels de travail. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de travail et de formation de ses apprenties et également assurer le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and work materials.

loans.name: Juan Tomas

texts.en:
Juan Tomas supports his family by making bread, pastry dishes, salads and a variety of other dishes, which he either cooks and sells to families in his neighborhood or sells in bulk to local restaurants. His small business is run out of his kitchen at home. This loan will allow him to purchase better supplies for preparing, cooking and restoring food as well as giving him more capital to increase the amount of food he can buy and sell. He currently has to make due using an empty bottle to shape tortillas on a wide ironing board and the families' supplies are used to support the business.

His wife Esther Maria and their three children - Jeraldine, Jehova and Jeremias - live a two-room home in the community of Juan Pablo Duarte. The semi-rural community lies close to the southern coast of the country in the eastern province of San Pedro.

NOTE: Juan Tomas is the president of his Bank of Hope - a group of Esperanza microentrepreneurs in a given community who help each other through the business management and loan repayment process. Juan Tomas and four other members of his solidarity group will be responsible for utilizing and paying back this loan of $750 together. There respective businesses will each receive an equal $150 share of the loan to expand their family businesses.

loans.use: Purchase veggetables, baking ingredients and meat as well as better tools for preparing, cooking and storing food.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.en:
Rosa Marina M. was born on 14 September 1965 in San Juan Comalapa, in the Department of Chimaltenango. Rosa recounts that like all the community, she suffered as a child as well as in part of her adolescence, because her parents had few economic resources. In 1982 her family was severely affected by the armed conflict, and one of the hardest moments was the loss of her husband as of twelve years ago. Because of this, she was extremely upset and the difficult situation meant she was solely responsible for providing an income to maintain her family. It was this situation that obliged her to fight for her children.

Now, she is a traditional artisan, and one of her dreams is to achieve economic stability: for this reason she wants to continue fighting to have the opportunity to deliver her products directly to a market, whether it be in Guatemala or even better overseas. She understands that currently the Guatemalan market and that of her own home town has some disadvantages: there is too much competition and this means that the products she makes have to be delivered at a lower price than she considers ideal. Thanks to Friendship Bridge, she has seized the opportunity to participate in the second cycle with the Women’s group EBEN-EZER, she feels a lot of gratitude towards this groups, because if it had not been for this organisation, she wouldn’t have had the opportunity and she considers them like part of her family who have offered her a lot of support.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En el año 1965 un 14 de septiembre, Nace la señora Rosa Marina ,M. en el municipio de san Juan Comalapa del Departemanto de Chimaltenango doña Rosa cuenta que ella pues como toda persona sufre de niña ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos, cuenta que tanto en su niñez y parte de su juventud sufrió. En el año de 1982 la familia de ella les afecto demasiado el conflicto armado, y uno de los fracasos mas fuertes fue la perdida de su esposo desde hace 12 años, y para ella ha sido muy doloroso ya que además de la difícil situación en la que se vive ella se hace cargo de gastos mantenimiento de la familia, fue la misma situación que la obligo a ella a luchar por sus hijos.

Ella se dedica actualmente a la artesanía típica y uno de sus mayores sueños es alcanzar una estabilidad económica por lo que quiere seguir luchando por tener la oportunidad de entregar sus productos a un mercado directamente, ya sea aquí en Guatemala o mucho mejor en el Mercado Extranjero, ella manifiesta que actualmente el mercado de Guatemala y en su propio municipio, tiene algunas desventajas ya que existe demasiada competencia y eso hace que el producto que ella tiene sea entregado mas barato del precio a la que ella considera mejor. Agrádese a Puente de Amistad la oportunidad que se le brinda ya que ella lleva el segundo ciclo con el Grupo mujeres EBEN-EZER y al mismo tiempo se siente agradecida con su grupo ya que de no ser por el grupo ella no tuviera esta oportunidad y considera parte de su familia que le han brindado mucho apoyo.

loans.use: Sale of typical artisanal products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and to purchase store fixtures

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is 58 years old and has 7 children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank Los Jazmines. She lives in the district of Moyobamba, in San Martin. Victoria has a business selling bread and pastries, which she started because she realized it was a way to generate her own income and be able to help in the finances of her home.

She has a stall in the market, but in addition she sells to the small restaurants in the area. She is doing very well. Now she counts on the support of her children in running the business, and with the activites of their home. Her goal is to continue building this business and making a high quality product. This depends on the success of her sales.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for $964.00 approximately, she will buy the ingredientes she uses most, such as flour, sacks of sugar, cartons of butter, yeast and other ingredientes.

La señora Victoria tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Jazmines, vive en el Distirto D. Moyobamba, en el Departamento D. San Martín. Se dedica la venta D. panes y dulces. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque se dio cuenta D. que era una alternativa para generar sus propios ingresos y poder aportar en la economía D. su hogar. Ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado pero además reparte a las bodegas D. la zona, le va bastante bien. Ahora cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos en el manejo del negocio y las actividades D. la casa, su meta es seguir adelante con esta actividad y seguir haciendo un producto D. calidad, ya que D. eso depenD. el éxito en sus ventas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 3,000.00 ( $ 964.00 aprox.) comprará los ingredientes que más utiliza como es la harina, azúcar en sacos, manteca en cajas, levadura y demás ingredientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase ingredientes for her bakery

loans.name: Hemed

texts.en: Hemed is a 32-year-old father of three. He lives in the Kisiwani area. He runs a shop selling cosmetics and other ladies’ beauty supplies. He developed his entrepreneurial skills through the Youth Self Employment Foundation. He is asking for $375  to expand his shop.

loans.use: To expand his cosmetics business

loans.name: Pulot

texts.en: Pulot R. lives in Mastchoh; he is married and has 5 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. During his partnership with our organization he showed himself as accurate borrower. He breeds and sells livestock and operates a dairy. He would like to purchase one bull and one milky cow.  He plans to expand the assortment of products he sells: pasteurized milk, buttermilk, sour cream, cottage cheese, and so on. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy this livestock, which will allow him to expand his product line and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To buy a bull and a cow for his livestock/dairy business

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay T. is a butcher in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He's married and has three children. He owns the butcher shop that serves one of the neighborhoods in Khachmaz. He runs the shop with the help of his wife and children.

Oktay has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 in order to purchase more animals that he will be able to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: To purchase animals for slaughter

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel makes his living driving a taxi around the city of Khoost in the beautiful western Ukraine. A pleasant mannered young man, operating his own taxi has fulfilled Pavel’s long-term desire to be self-employed. He offers good service to his customers and tries to give them an enjoyable ride. Pavel has been in business for about 2 years. His monthly income is typically around $700, a good middle wage for a single person.

Pavel has requested a six month loan of $500 to help purchase a fare meter for his taxi. These meters allow taxi drivers to more accurately charge for their services based on time and distance rather than set fares. We are happy for this opportunity to help Pavel improve his business and continue his success.

loans.use: To purchase a meter

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 4. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 58 and 50. Agnes is a cloth and soap seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Greta

texts.es:
Mrs Greta is a member of the Indo American Community Bank, located at Jr. Fitscarral No. 246, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 69 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is a retired teacher.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for approximately $110, Greta started a business letting rooms. Currently, she buys and sells various products in addition to letting rooms. Greta gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast. Afterwards, she works until 5 pm selling her merchandise. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, Greta plans to buy mattresses, bed sheets, and larger quantities of merchandise such as perfumes, candies, etc.

Greta is very glad that not being near her children has not prevented her from working, helping her husband, and succeeding in improving her life. She is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Greta pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Fitscarral No 246, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 69 años es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es profesor jubilado. Greta con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de alquiler de cuartos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería y de alquiler de cuartos, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar su desayuno y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de su mercadera hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: colchones, sabanas y mayor cantidad de mercadería, perfumes, golosinas, etc. Greta esta muy feliz, ya que a pesar de no vivir cerca de sus hijos no es impedimento para no poder trabajar y salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of goods and materials for the business

loans.name: Eseosa

texts.en: Eseosa E. has been in business since 1993. She is married with four children and is 39 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells bread and needs a loan of $600 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Ema Iaulualo's Group

texts.en: The SPBD has disbursed $4800 ST to the first group in Sili 3 Center in regards with their loan applications submitted.  Their loan applied were mainly for agriculture use .  They never had this experience until they were being trained by the SPBD officers in order to operate their starting businesses.  It is a very helpful way for them to earn money to support their families in any way.

loans.use: purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, week killer, weed spray, bush knives, Vegetable seeds(tomato,cucumber,cabbages), fertilize, rake, gloves,boots,

loans.name: Ema Luz

texts.es:
Señora Ema Luz, 43 years of age, is the mother of four children, three of whom are independent and greatly support her in her business thanks to their education and the good habits she imparted upon them as their mother. Staying at home is the youngest of her children who is studying. She lives with her husband, señor Zoilo, who works independently. For some time, Ema Luz has sold grains (corn, beans, manioc flour, and a variety of others) wholesale to be able to contribute to the family's expenses and, above all, for the studies of her youngest child. Thanks to the increase in her clientele, she has found that she needs to expand and increase her business. It is for this that she needs the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ema Luz de 43 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son independientes y le apoyan mucho en su negocio gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que ella las impartió como madre, quedando en su casa, el último de sus hijos quien está estudiando. Ella vive con su esposo el señor Zoilo quien se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente. Ema Luz se dedica a la venta de granos (maíz, fréjol, fariña entre otras variedades) al por mayor desde hace ya tiempo para poder contribuir con los gastos familiares y sobre todo con el estudio del último de sus hijos. Debido al aumento de su clientela se encuentra en la necesidad de ampliar e implementar su negocio, por ello que requiere del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Enlarge and expand her business.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aline H. was born around 1978 in Porto Novo, the political capital of BENIN. She is married to Mr. Adjobignon ADONADJI, a retailer of second-hand clothing. Mrs. Aline H. has been selling used bottles and cans since 1993 in the Dantokpa market in Cotonou. She is the mother of two children. These bottles and cans are bought from households before being cleaned and delivered to makers of local leaf- and root-based medicinal products. She is asking for this loan to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Dame H. Aline est née vers 1978 à Porto Novo la capitale politique du BENIN. Elle est mariée au sieur ADONADJI Adjobignon revendeur de vêtements usagers. Dame H. Aline vend des bouteilles et bidons usagers depuis 1993 au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle est mère de deux enfants. Ces bouteilles et bidons sont achetées auprès des ménages avant d'être mis au propre pour être livré aux fabricants de produits pharmaceutique à base de feuille et racines locales. Elle vient solliciter pour mieux servir sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy and sell used bottles and cans

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il est mécanicien à Kpalimé, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla A. is 35 years old, married and the father of three (3) children. He is a mechanic in Kpalime, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan he would like to buy work tools so that he could better respond to the needs of his customers. He is expecting this opportunity will improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work tools to respond to the needs of his customers

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Madame Alimata T. est âgée de 49 ans et vit avec ses 8(huit) enfants et son époux dans une famille monogame au quartier Somono de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Issue d’une famille de commerçants, elle n’a jamais fréquenté l’école et commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait les poissons au marché journalier de Ségou. Très expérimentée dans le domaine du commerce, elle opta pour l’achat vente des bazins teintés et des pagnes wax (de différentes qualités) depuis maintenant 15 ans. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est en relation depuis 4 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, 5 pièces de pagnes wax, 3 pièces de tissus Bazin (qui seront teints avant la vente) et  2 jeux de couvres lits au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.) auprès des commerçants grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement au niveau des entreprises, chez elle à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers de la ville de Ségou. Ce cycle de production (achat teinture et vente) dure environ un mois.
Madame Alimata Thiero espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA.qui lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de ses affaires et aider son mari à supporter les charges de la famille (nourritures, frais scolaires etc.).
texts.en:
Mrs. Alimata Thiero is 49 years old and lives with her eight (8) children and husband as a monogamous family in the Somono neighborhood of Ségou ( the fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali).

She was born into a family of business people but was never able to attend school. She started generating income through business activities very early on, learning from her mother, who sold fish in the markets of Ségou. She is very innovative in her business activities and has opted to buy and sell hand dyed bazin (colored fabric) and wax dyed pagne (decorative cloth), of different qualities, for the last 15 years. This is her second personal loan and she has also made four (4) group loans that were duly repaid.

With this loan she plans to buy five (5) pieces of wax dyed "pagne", three (3) pieces of "bazin" fabric (which must be dyed before selling) and two (2) sets of bed sheets from commercial wholesalers at the central market in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). She sells items at retail for cash, and to businesses for credit, payable in monthly installments. She sells these items from her home and through traveling sales throughout the neighborhoods of Ségou. Her production cycle ( buy, dye, and sell) takes about one month.

Mrs. Alimata Thiero hopes to realize a monthly income of 50,000 francs CFA which would allow her to expand her business and assist her husband with meeting family expenses. (food,school expenses etc.)

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wax dyed "pagne" (decorative cloth), "bazin" (colored fabric) and bed sheets

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 30 años, es madre soltera, vive con su madre anciana y sus dos menores hijos, su pareja los abandonó. Se dedica a trabajar en sus cultivos desde su niñez, ha sembrado 15 sacos de semilla de papa, asimismo tiene sembrado arvejas, pero en menor cantidad. Se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los desayunos y almuerzos de su familia, después, a eso de las 8 saca la leche de su vaca, prepara los quesos y reparte a los negociantes, esto es solo dos veces por semana, también lleva a sus vacas al campo, y finalmente se va a su chacra todos los dias.  Le agrada la actividad que realiza, pero le falta el capital, nos dice que la agricultura es muy cansada y requiere mayor inversión. Es la primera vez que saca un préstamo de esta institución. Además de mantener en buen estado sus tierras, este préstamo para ella es la oportunidad de incursionar en otro negocio, así que también se va dedicar a la compra y venta de carne roja.
texts.en:
Irma is a 30-year-old single mother of two, who lives with her mother (her partner left them on their own). She has worked on her land since childhood, sowing 15 sacks of potato seed, as well as peas although in lesser quantities. She is up at 4am to prepare breakfast and lunch for her family; by 8am she is milking the cow, and preparing cheeses which she distributes to her clients twice per week; she then takes her cows out to pasture, and daily attends to her small farm. She enjoys her endeavors, but she lacks capital - she has shared with us that agricultural work is exhausting and requires heavy investment. This is her first request for a loan from this institution. In addition to maintenance of her land, this loan will provide her with an opportunity to invest in another business, so she will start buying and selling red meat.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for farming investment and to start a business.

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Cruz del Carmen se dedica a la actividad de crianza de cerdos en su propia casa de habitación donde les brinda las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo para luego proceder al destace o venta de estos animales.

Se ha caracterizado por vender carne de cerdo desde hace 16 años siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene a sus dos pequeñas hijas las cuales están en edad escolar.
Debido a la necesidad de adquirir los cerdos para su actividad, la señora Cruz ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los cerdos para proceder con su comercialización en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the Chichigalpa district in the city of Chinandega, Cruz del Carmen is dedicated to breeding pigs in her own house. Here she offers them the conditions necessary for their development, which later leads to the slaughter or sale of these animals. She has sold pork for 16 years, this being the only income with which she provides for her two young daughters who are in school. Due to the necessity of acquiring pigs for her activities, Cruz has looked for the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit her to buy the pigs to continue her business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Ni

texts.en: Mrs. Ni C. lives in Svay Ta Thorm village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 34-year-old widow with three children: the oldest is a tailor, the second one attends the local school, and the youngest one is just three years old. Mrs. Ni C.’s oldest child has a problem because her sewing machine is too old and needs to be replaced. Mrs. Ni C. is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some material for her child's business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and some cloths for her child business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel R. C. es soltero y tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes y carnes llamado “Mini Super Hermanos R.” el cual lleva 26 años de operación, este negocio lo obtuvo como herencia de su papa y es manejado por él y sus hermanos.
El señor Daniel R. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías para surtir el negocio debido a que tienen muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel R. C. is single and has his own meat and groceries business. His business name is "Mini Super Hermanos R." and its been in business for 26 years. He inherited this business thru his father and its managed by his brother and him.

Mr. Daniel R. is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for his business, since he has a lot of clients.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his business

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY a 40 ans elle est mariée et mere de famille.Elle travaille comme agent de sante communautaire.parallelement ce travail elle vend des beignets pour arrondir les fin de fin.Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarite des enfants.Elle sollocite un pret pour developper son commerce.
texts.en:
Khady, 40, is married and the mother of a family. She is a community health worker and at the same time, she sells beignets (fried dough) to make ends meet. The income she makes from the business allows her to pay school fees for her children. She is requesting this loan to further develop her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her little business

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam H., 40, lives in Siem Reap with her husband and four children. She makes and sells cakes, which she has done since 2004. She earns approximately USD $1 per day. Her husband raises pigs and earns USD $5 a day. All of their children are in school. Mrs. Eam H. would like to take out a loan to purchase materials so that she can increase the number of cakes she sells each day.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Lubajja Traders (A) Group

texts.en:
Betty is a widow with five kids and three businesses! Her children range from 12 to 22 and all are currently in school. Betty manages to pay school fees at private schools for all five of them.

Betty works alone rearing cattle, pigs, and poultry. In her cattle business, she has two dairy cows and six cows that she is raising to sell for meat. Her two dairy cows produce 10 liters of milk per day, which she sells at 200 USH per liter to the community around her.

In addition to these cows, she currently has five pigs, two males which she will soon sell for meat and three females that she will keep to continue to grow the business.

In her poultry business, she has three layers (chickens that are kept for laying eggs) and four broilers (chickens that are consumed for food). In addition to this work, which she does on her own, she is working to expand her farm. She has created a work schedule for herself where she does agriculture in the morning and her other work (except her morning milking) in the afternoons. She is employing someone now to help with her agricultural work.

Now Betty is asking for a loan of 300,000 USH. She needs to purchase some chemicals to improve her farm. Betty hopes one day to move from her father’s place, where she and her children live now. She would like to build a very large house where she and all her children can live.

loans.use: To purchase some chemicals to improve yields on her farm

loans.name: Olivet

texts.en: Olivet O. is a 43-year-old single parent with 3 children. She owns a drinking bar where she sells drinks and provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old and is a widow with four children. She sells secondhand underwear. She has been in this business for a long time.

She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more secondhand underwear to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand underwear to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Yolanda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling roasted pig (lechon) in the community.
