Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $170) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as savings for her children's future.

About GDMPC:

nGata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Hồ Thị

texts.en:
Hà Hồ Thị (100106034) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To earn a living, Hà owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Hà is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Justa Consuelo

texts.es: La Señora Justa Consuelo A. O. tiene la edad de 59 años, es una madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 24 años que se dedica  a este negocio. Justa comenzó su negocio con la venta de refrescos naturales, pan y  gaseosas sus clientes acudían a su pulpería, por lo que ellos mismos brindaron la sugerencia de que ampliara su negocio y comprara productos diarios, por lo que decide establecerse en su vivienda para ofrecer todo lo que sus clientes necesitan. Y así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y no perder su negocio y comprar granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, pan y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Justa es de mantener este negocio ya que es por su negocio que ha logrado mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Justa Consuelo A. O., 59, is the single mother of three children who go to school. She has had a mini market for over 24 years. She started her business selling natural beverages, bread, and soft drinks. Her customers came to her mini market, and they suggested that she expand her business and buy daily needs products. She decided to set up in her home to be able to offer her customers all that they need. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital. She does not want to lose her business. She will buy basic grains, sweets, juice, bread, and natural drinks. Justa’s dream is to keep this business, since it is through the business that she has been able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Bích

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị Bích (1108060232) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, L. owns & operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $113 US) a month from these activities.

In 2003, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es:
La señora Inés A., socia emprendedora y entusiasta. Tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente, con 3 hijos, con su esfuerzo ella y su esposo hasta el momento han comprado  su carro de transporte publico y darle una mejorar  calidad educativa a sus hijos.
Recientemente empezó a  trabajar con EDAPROSPO _ Prosperidad, asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Los Jazmines”, la cual esta conformada por 13 socios, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: comercio, producción y servicio.
Inés se dedica en forma  ambulatoria desde hace 8 años a la compra de diversos calzados usados, reparación y venta en ferias, así como también cuenta con el trabajo de cobradora de transporte público, desde hace 4 años.
El préstamo de S/. 400.00 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizara en la compra  de diversos calzados  usados y materiales como pegamento, plantillas, hilos, y otros.
Inés le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un carro  nuevo de transporte publico, comprarse maquinas y adquirir un local propio para la  venta de calzados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Inés A. is an enthusiastic, hard-working businesswoman. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. With great effort she and her husband have until now purchased the car with which they provide public transportation and are able to provide a quality education to their children. Recently she began to work with EDAPROSPO Prosperity, serving as President of the communal fun “Los Jazmines” which consists of 13 member who have various jobs such as business, production, and service. Inés has been a street vendor for 8 years upon buying a variety of used shoes, repairing and selling them in the markets. She has also been working as a fare collector in public transportation for 4 years. The loan for S/. 400.00 Nuevos Soles will be used to buy a variety of used shoes and materials such as glue, insoles, thread, and more. In the future Inés would like to buy a new public transportation car, sewing machines, and rent her own locale to sell shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of used shoes and materials such as glue, insoles, thread, and more.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker has owned a home products store for eleven years, selling home products and cleaning supplies. He is outstanding in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and offers a large variety of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and there were not a lot of passer-bys. Baker decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and likes sales. 

Baker is a 45 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He requested a loan of $1300 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his home products store

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Cette dame est revendeuse de produits génériques ; elle exerce cette activité de manière ambulante mais aussi dans le marché d’Agoè Adaugbo les jours de marché. Elle est mariée à un ferrailleur et le couple a 03 enfants. C’est en 2006 qu’elle a pris la décision de vendre les produits génériques à la mode actuellement à Lomé, pour aider financièrement son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 01 carton de Paracétamol, 01 carton d’Amodiaquine, 02 cartons de Zudrex, 02 cartons d’Efferalgan. Elle compte sur sa meilleure connaissance du marché pour agrandir son commerce dans un bref délai.
texts.en:
This woman is a retailer of generic products. She does this business from door to door but also in the market of Agoè Adaugbo on market days. She is married to a scrap dealer and they have 03 children. She decided in 2006 to sell generic products in fashion currently in Lomé in order to support her husband financially in the education of their children. She needs to replenish her stock. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Wages in order to buy 01 of paracetamol, 01 carton of Amodiaquine, 02 cartons of Zudrex, 02 cartons of Efferalgan. She counts on her profound knowledge of the market in order to increase her business in the shortest possible time.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of generic products

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Phnom Penh. She has been selling meat balls, duck eggs and fry frogs since 2007 to earn a living, and is able to make about US$5 of profit every day. Her husband, Vong Sarann, 43, is a driver. He makes approximately US$5 as well. Meas Sophari would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to make a new investment. Meas wants to sell clothes to have additional profit to raise the standard of living.

loans.use: Sell clothes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, a 30-year-old married father of two children who are all currently in the basic school, has been selling foodstuffs for three years now.  Trading in cereals such maize, groundnut, beans and other food items, he buys directly from farmers at a relatively low price and then sells at the local market in the town where he lives with his family. He also treks with some of his goods to nearby markets to sell.  He is requesting a loan to buy the goods in bulk so that he can distribute to a number of customers. This he believes will reduce the need for frequent traveling.

loans.use: To buy more cereals such as maize, beans etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona P. is currently in the business of selling cassava and Irish patatoes at the Konyokonyo market. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase hens and roosters to sell. Lona is 27 years old and is married; her husband is a soldier. She has 3 children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and the empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing hens and roosters

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel  vive en la calle  “Illampu” de la zona 21 de diciembre de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus familiares, como cuidador con opción a compra.

Angel posee un minibus el cual trabaja como chofer propietario en rutas de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para el cambio de motor de su vehiculo, ya que  actualmente presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo normales. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Angel lives on Illampu Street in the 21 de diciembre zone of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children, all of school age, in his relatives’ home as a caretaker, with the option of purchasing it. Angel drives a minibus, which he owns, along various routes in the city. He will use his loan to change the motor in his bus, as currently it’s failing and preventing him from completing his usual work commute. This is his first loan with Impro, as he passed the evaluation required to qualify for him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to the motor in his vehicle

loans.name: Junica's Group

texts.en:
“A man without determination will not succeed!” says Mrs. Junica B., the loving wife of Rambert Theodore B. of barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with two children namely, Rafael Jean Andrei and Jhobeyl Quinz Xavier B.. They want their children to be successful in their chosen profession so that they will have a stable job someday.

Junica's husband's occupation is that of nurse employed by the PLTCI LAT Medical Center located at Bascaran, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya while Junica is engaged in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products in their village to earn additional income. Being friendly and approachable, she acquires many customers who order her products. In this regard, she wants to acquire more products but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she applied for loan to the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000 to strengthen her capital and acquire more products to be sold in their village.

loans.use: additional capital for her costmetics-sales business

loans.name: Kamandar

texts.en:
Kamandar is applying for a loan from Kiva for the second time. With his earlier Kiva loan, he improved his dairy business and started a sheep breeding business. In spite of the fact that this business is new for him, he is confident that this business also will be very successful. To achieve this, he again needs the help of Kiva.
He is going to buy 10 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business, and that is why he is applying for the loan amount of 2,000 AZN.

"Thank you very much Kiva!"

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Battseren T.  is 35 years old and lives with her son in the Tuv province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son, Tumenbayar, is 9 years old and attends a local secondary school.

Battseren operates a clothing-making business in her town. She makes variety of traditional Mongolian clothes such as deels and hantaaz (traditional Mongolian coats and shirts). Battseren started her business in 2008 with capital of 500,000 tugrugs after working as a sewing technician for a private company. She has built a stable business in her first year of operation and has become an experienced seamstress. She has many loyal customers who are very satisfied with her quality products. She recently hired two new assistants to keep up with demand and her working capital now exceeds 4,800,000 tugrugs. 

Battseren has many plans for the future and hopes to soon expand her work area. She says, "By expanding my business operation, I will be able to better keep up with demand." She is requesting a 2,400,000 tugrug loan to purchase fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada Q. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 53 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Iluminada raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $113 a month from this activity.

In 2005, Iluminada joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Iluminada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: I. Latifatou est née en 1975 à Abéokouta au Nigéria. Latifatou réside depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADELOU Soulé, un commerçant, Latifatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Latifatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Latifatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs 8 ans, Latifatou mène comme activité, la vente de tissus de façon ambulante à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qu’elle utilise pour faire face à ses différentes charges. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Latifatou s’approvisionne. Latifatou a déjà bénéficié de ALIDé, trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Actuellement Latifatou éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits. C'est la raison pour laquelle Latifatou sollicite un quatrième prêt afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité.
texts.en:
Latifatou I. was born in 1975 at Abeokouta, Nigeria. For the past 10 years Latifatou has lived in the Ayetawadja neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Latifatou is the mother of 3 school aged children and married to Soule Adelou, a businessman. Latifatou lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple meet the needs of the family. Latifatou did not attended school. When she was about 8 years old, Latifatou started to sell fabrics by hawking in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. With this business she earned income which she used to meet her various responsibilities. Latifatou buys her provisions in Lome, Togo, a country neighboring on Benin. Latifatou has already benefited from 3 loans made with ALIDe and these have been duly repaid. Latifatou has recently been experiencing difficulty in acquiring her provisions. For this reason Latifatou has requested this, her fourth loan, to satisfy her customers demands and increase the scope of her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de pièces de tissus.

loans.name: Felicidad's Group

texts.en:
Felicidad B. is 38 years old and from the village of Cabisera 5. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Felicidad B..
Felicidad is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Cabisera 5, Baribad, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years of age, married with six children aged between 3 and 18 years, all attending school. The family owns and resides in a four-roomed house where she stays with five people, the rest of the children residing in the village with her parents. Florence takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home and has three meals a day. Florence's greatest monthly expenses include the utility bills, school fees for the children, medication, and food for the family.

For over ten years Florence has owned a mini-bakery retailing chapatti from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and so incurs transport costs to and from shopping and receives an average of 40 customers a day. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season because she works from a muddy place, and ever-increasing prices for baking flour and cooking oil.

She has been with MCDT for over seven years and will now be servicing her sixteenth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. Florence wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and eventually hopes to start a big bakery .

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of  cooking oil and cartons of bakling flour

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria Natividad Milán Agáuchela  tiene 31 años, es casada, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como gallinas, chanchos, cuyes y borregos  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria  le gusta lavar cocinar en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives on the edge of the town of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province. She is a part of the "Rural Window Group Enmanuel," which is an enclave located 45 minutes from Guaranda, the capital of the Bolivár province. There are a total of 17 members in this farming and agricultural community. They are indigenous people and speak Quechua. Maria farms in order to improve the economic status of her family. The crops that she mainly grows are corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes. She also raises livestock such as chickens, hogs, Guinea pigs, and sheep. She sells the livestock from her home, but she takes her harvests to the main marketplace in Guaranda every six months. The principle cultural activity is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Maria also likes to cook and do the washing in her spare time. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her farm work, particularly fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good income for her family. Her biggest challenges are the problems with the weather and the plant diseases that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Yerkenie

texts.es: El Sr. Yerkenie G. S.     él se desempeña como Profesor de educación primaria  el tiene de laborar  para esta institución doce  años, es padre de un  hijos en edad escolar, el es casado  actualmente. Ha tenido  tres  créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito él lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en  su casa de habitación, para tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Yerkenie G. S. has been a primary school teacher for twelve years. He is the father of two school-age children and is currently married. He has had three previous loans from CEPRODEL. He will use this loan to purchase building materials to make improvements to his home and thereby make it a more respectable dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand and bricks for construction on his home

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama J. is fifty years old and married with five children; she has four sons and one daughter. Her eldest child is in secondary school, and the others are in primary school. Her husband is a driver. They live in Laka, where she has a shop selling provisions including beverages and biscuits. Mariama has been in this business for fifteen years. She joined LAPO Sierra Leone over a year ago, and she has taken three previous loans to expand her busness. She pays the school fees for her children with her profit. Now she is asking LAPO Sierra Leone with the help of Kiva lenders to loan her 2,000,000 SLL so she can expand her business.

loans.use: This loan will be use to purchase bags of water, other beverages, and biscuits.

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan B. inicia su primer ciclo con 8 socias que son del Distrito D. Huaytara, departamento D. Huancavelica, la comunidad esta ubicada a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la ganadería y la industrialización D. lácteos.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, comida, frutas y la elaboración D. productos lácteos.
Como es el caso D. la señora Elvira es presidenta del Banco Comunal, Elvira es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales 2 son varones y 1 mujer, Elvira se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, del cual obtiene leche que luego procesa en quesos, su negocio se ubica en la comunidad D. Chocorvo, sus ventas los realiza en su Distrito y en algunas oportunidades lleva a la ciudad D. Lima, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. quesos D. los demás productores D. la zona. Elvira quiere capacitarse para mejorar día a día en el ámbito familiar y también en el negocio.
Los sueños D. Elvira son comprar su casa en Lima, construir un hotel en su comunidad y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Juan B. begins its new cycle with 8 members from the district of Huaytara, departament of Huancavelica. The community is located 4 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The principal activities in the community are cattle farming and industrialized dairy production. The members have different businesses, such as selling groceries, food, fruit and making dairy products. Such is the case of Elvira, president of the communal bank. Elvira is in a common law marriage and has 3 children, two boys and a girl. Elvira raises cattle from which she obtains milk that she later makes into cheese. Her business is located in the community of Chocorvo. She sells in her district and at times she takes it to the city of Lima. She does this with the help of her husband. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of cheeses from the other producers in the area. Elivira wants to train to improve every day in her family and in her business as well. Elvira's dreams are to buy a house in Lima, to build a hotel in her community snd for her children to have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses

loans.name: Las Miciones Group

texts.es:
este banco de emprendimieto conformado 11 integrantes los cuales en su gran mayoria son oriundos de santa cruz, tarija, chuquisaca, de los 11 integrantes la gran mayoria tiene negocio propio en la localidad de san jose, todos los socios viven en la zona de san jose en distintos barrios, se conocen y se garantizan entre ellos.

La presidenta es la señora Rosmery y se dedica a la actividad d ela venta de ropa desde hace muchos años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es una persona responsable y dinamica y fue elegida como presidenta por la solidaridad que demostro con su compañeras de grupo, el dinero dle credito lo utilizara en la compra y renovacion de mercadeia, ya que esta llegando la epoca de invierno. 

Su sueño de este banco de emprendimiento es llegar a ser el  mejor banco de emprendimiento en el cumplimiento de sus cuotas todos los socios son padres de familia y madre de familias que en muchos casos sacan adelante solas  a sus familias, estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 11 members, the majority of whom are natives of Santa Cruz, Tarija, and Chuquisaca. Of the 11 members, the majority have their own business in the area of San Jose. All of the members live in the San Jose area in different neighborhoods. They know each other, and as a group they guarantee each member's loans. The president is Rosmery, who has had a business selling clothing for many years. She is married and has 2 children who are school-aged. She is a responsible and dynamic person who was elected president of the group for the solidarity she has demonstrated with her fellow group members. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to renew her inventory, since we are approaching the winter season. Her dream for this communal bank is to become the best communal bank in terms of making its payments. All of the members are parents with families, and in many cases they are single parents who are trying to advance their families on their own. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (winter clothing)

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children aged between 3 and 13 years old. All of the children are currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been farming for 12 years and has one employee. Her products are maize, milk, beans and eggs which she sells to the local market. Anne is also a tailor. Her biggest challenge in farming is the fluctuation in market prices and poultry diseases, which results to great losses.

Anne has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after she successfully completed a previous loan of Kes.30,000. She has requested this loan for Kes.50,000 to expand her poultry project. The extra income from this loan will boost her other sources of income hence their needs will be well taken care of.

She is hoping that the project will have expanded in 5 years time and she will be able to meet her expenses.
She is grateful to Juhudi because she has been empowered financially.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is divorced. He lives in Novomoskovsk. He is a market entrepreneur selling men’s outerwear, such as t-shirts and shirts, in the central marketplace of his hometown. Victor’s vending kiosk is located in a good spot, drawing many potential customers to his business. Victor has invested 45,000 Grivnyas in this business. He is making about 10,000 Grivnyas in income. 

Victor is requesting a loan of 14,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional seasonal merchandise. He usually travels to Odessa, southern Ukraine, to buy assorted inventory from wholesalers there. Victor launched this venture two years ago. He admits he is still in the process of learning some of the nuances of his trade. Victor’s sick father lives with him and is incapable of getting a job. Victor’s enterprise is the only source of income for the two of them.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Wellineth

texts.en:
Wellineth P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 38 years old. Wellineth is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Wellineth owns & operates a general store, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Wellineth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years now.

Wellineth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Wellineth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Wellineth is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Wellineth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees and to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew (pictured next to his fish ponds) is 65 years old. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 24 and 39. Two of the children are attending school. He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for over 30 years and has employed one farm-hand. His farm produces maize, tea, beans, bananas, milk, fish and nappier grass which he sells to the local market. He faces the challenge of the high prices of farm material, lack of enough feed for the fish and poor prices for his products.

Mathew has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to expand his dairy activities and earn him income that will help him pay school fees for his children in college.

In the future, he would like to expand his dairy business and supply his milk in wholesale to other retailers. He says that through Juhudi Kilimo, he has been able to grow and really appreciates the support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, de 46 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Justo de 56 años y sus 3 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Guillermina en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, los plátanos y el café que cultiva, están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y aún le gusta cultivar su tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a 46-year-old mother who is very happy and hardworking. She lives in her own home with her 56-year-old husband, Justo, and their three younger children, who are the primary motivation for all the couple's efforts. The long days Guillermina works on her land have made her an agricultural expert once again. She takes very good care of the bananas and coffee she grows and always obtains a good sale price for her products. She has been working in agriculture for 30 years, and she still likes farming since she's done it since she was a girl. She considers transporting her products to the city market to be the most difficult part of her job. With time, she hopes to buy more land to increase her production. This is her third loan with MFP. She is saving money to make her payments on time because she doesn't want to cause problems to the other women in her lending group, where she is very happy. With the 2000 soles she is requesting, Guillermina will buy fertilizer to care for her farm land.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Presley

texts.es:
José de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín, el tiene en la parte delantera de su casa una pequeña tienda. 

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar, comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo arroz y bebidas poco a poco pudo surtir mas su tienda y tener unas vitrinas de madera. Vende arroz, bebidas, huevos, lácteos, todo el día desde las 07h30 hasta las 21h00pm. 

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, huevos, lácteos. En el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years of age, lives in a peri-urban area of el Fortin. For two years now, he's been running a small grocery store in front of his house. This store began out of necessity in order to help his family. He began by selling rice and beverages and then little by little began expanding his products and brought in display cases for his items. He now sells rice, soft drinks, eggs, milk products (every day from 07h30am until 21h00pm). With this loan, he would like to buy additional beverages, eggs and dairy products to restock his business. In the future, he would like to finish building his home and continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bebidas, huevos, lacteos (beverages, eggs and dairy products)

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas M. S. es padre de 2 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que el y su esposa trabaja en maquiladora tiempo extra para poder completar con los gastos de la casa y ofrecer una buena educación.  En este momento el requiere de un préstamo para comprar los artículos escolares y compra de uniformes.
texts.en:
Tomas M. S. is the father of two children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. For this reason, he and his wife work extra time in an assembly plant so that they can meet the household expenses and provide them with a better education. At this time, he is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies and uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School expenses

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antolina; ella tiene 28  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, quinua, garbanzos y habas, ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro que queda ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde vender los granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como un saco de trigo, garbanzos y quinua al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antolina, 28, is married and has three children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates household chores with the sale of dry goods like wheat, quinoa, chickpeas and lima beans. She sells in the city of Cucso’s Huancaro Market. She works from 8am until 4pm. She would like to have a stall in which to sell the dry grains. She is asking for a loan to buy dry grains like a sack of wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those that share her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains like a sack of wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: Grace Adwoa Kubruku

texts.en: Grace Adwoa Kubruku A. sells fruit at Elmina. She is married to a farmer. Grace has been selling fruit for seven years. She responsibly helps her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy extra fruit for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy extra fruit for sale

loans.name: 72Nd Women Group

texts.en:
Mamai G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 72nd Women. She is 44 years old, widowed, and has eight children between the ages of 7 and 29 years. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to financial difficult.

For 12 years, she has been selling rice, onions, tomato, salt, pepper etc. in 72nd Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy rice, onions, tomato, salt, pepper etc. She describes herself as a jovial woman whose goal is to build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Blessing is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy rice, onions, tomato, salt, pepper etc.

loans.name: Loani Ole Tayaka

texts.en:
Loani has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town since early this year.  He finds the business profitable.  He is 63 years old, married to Naitoi Wetaka, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy three calves and five sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Loani hopes to grow his income generation so that he can be able to send his children to a good school.

loans.use: To buy three  calves and five  sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Zayrakan

texts.en:
Zayrakan K. is 54 and has eight children; seven are grown and live on their own, and the youngest son studies at school.  Her husband Jamanak worked at the local school for 37 years as a teacher of mathematics and now is on pension. 

More than 20 years ago, in order to find a means of subsistence for their large family, Zayrakan with her husband decided to engage in livestock breeding, with the initial sum of 16,000 Kyrgyz Soms.  With the revenue, they were able to give a good education to all of their children.  In spite of all expenses of the large family, they managed to expand their herd of cattle and today Zayrakan’s farm has four milch cows, thirty sheep, ten goats and two horses. 

Zayrakan wants to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenue from this loan, Zayrakan plans to reconstruct a barn for her cattle to provide good conditions of cattle maintenance.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa N. lives in the Mengo Kisenyi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who aren't in school.     Hanifa has a business of selling food and vegetables. She has been in this business for one and a half years, and she works six days out of every week. 

Hanifa sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Hanifa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and cabbages. The main business challenges for Hanifa include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to start going to farmers directly.   

Hanifa lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun V., 45, is a busy woman who earns money from various ventures. She cultivates rice in the Province of Kompong Chhnang. She buys when rice is at the lowest price and then resells it to gain income. 

She is a widowed mother who has given birth to three children. All of her children are unmarried and working in various occupations. They share their salary with Soeun V. to manage the whole expenses in the family. Soeun V. believes that during the rice harvesting season she requires capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will resell them when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Diosleida Bertalina

texts.es:
Diosleida de 29 años, ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante años para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Viviendo en una zona  periurbana llamada Paraíso comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo. 

Vendiendo con pocos víveres en la parte delantera de su casa completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña tienda en su casa. Vende caramelos, cachitos, arroz, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar aceite, azúcar, arroz y una vitrina pequeña, en el futuro quiere tener suficiente dinero para darle una buena vida a su hijo.
texts.en: Diosleida, age 29, has worked hard with great dedication for years to help her husband with the household costs. She lives in a periurban zone called Paraiso. She started up her store in order to maintain her family and help her husband. She sold a few groceries in the front of her house. Her small store is located in her home. She sells candy, croissants, rice, drinks, etc. She works from 7 am to 7 pm every day. In order to continue running her business she wants to buy oil, sugar, rice and a small display case. In the future she wants to have enough money to give her son a good life.

loans.use: oil, sugar, rice

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a clothes selling business for the past six months, selling from home to her neighbors. Mariam faces a major challenge in competition from other clothes sellers. She hopes to expand and establish a shop in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Leso's (Khanga's) for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Gulnura's Group

texts.en:
Gulnura M. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married. Her husband works as a warehouse supervisor. They have two daughters and one son. Their son studies at university and their daughters are in school. 

Gulnura works in a sewing shop. Four years ago she rented a piece of land and started an agricultural business. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase fertilizers. In the future, she wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman who lives in Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a pig-fattening business. Her husband Noel, who is 52 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 18 and 29 years old. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future house renovation. E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha S. is a 26-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She has worked in agriculture for many years and makes a profit of approximately $1.75 each day to use for her family’s needs. Pha S. is blessed with two young children who are not enrolled in school. Her husband works as a car driver. At the present time, Pha S.’s husband is paying for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. In order to solve this problem, Pha S. is applying for a loan to purchase a second motorcycle for her husband, which will allow him to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam A. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, one of whom is in school. Mariam also takes care of her mother. Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

Mariam has a business selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Mariam sells her products door-to-door, at retail prices. Mariam has requested a loan of 60,0000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Mariam's main business challenge is the rainy season. Her goals and hopes are to start importing clothes for her business and to build her own house. .

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 39-year-old married woman with 5 children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the textile business for 10 years. Her hardships are limited capital and price fluctuations. Her vision is running a wholesale business, educating her family, building a house, and owning motorcycles. Shamim intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Inshirah

texts.en:
Inshirah H. is a 46-year-old married woman who has three children.

Inshirah decided to do something in her life so she can feel productive and to help in supporting her family. That’s when, one year ago,  she started a small home business selling few types of cosmetics. 

Through this one year she widened her product base to include more types of cosmetics, accessories and clothes, and gained a good reputation among her neighbors. In the meantime she is depending on word of mouth as a way to attract more customers.

Now Inshirah is applying for a loan to buy more products in order to cover as much  of the customers’ needs in her area as she can.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Fazail

texts.en: Fazail A. has raised cattle and farmed for 8 years. With two children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, he has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today, Fazail finds himself in need of purchasing more cattle in order to raise and sell them when necessary. For this reason, Fazail is obtaining a loan of 600 AZN order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and fodder.

loans.name: Akohode

texts.fr: Akohodé est née le 28 Avril 1976 et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Akohodé est mariée à Nazaire. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a juste un an que Akohodé et sa famille se sont installés à Ekpè Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Akohodé n'est jamais allée à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akohodé vend divers produits (biscuits, etc.) et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Akohodé achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Akohodé mène cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Akohodé d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Akohodé is born April 28, 1976, and is the mother of four children, who all attend school. Akohodé is married to Nazaire. The couple takes care of the various family duties together. Just a year ago, Akohodé and her family settled in Ekpe Dandji, in the township of Seme-Podji. Akohodé never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Akohodé sells various products (cookies, etc.) and charcoal from her home. Akohodé purchases her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Akohodé has been active in this business for eight years, and has already been granted two loans, which both were repaid to ALIDé. This third loan will certainly make it possible for Akohodé to raise her level of activity and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and various food products (cookies, etc.)

loans.name: Conchellah

texts.en:
Concellah is 34 years old and married with five children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He really values his family and he works hard to meet their needs. 

He joined Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend, and since then he has a lot of hope for his business because he can access loans easily.  He hopes that one day he will expand his business into wholesale.  

He needs 50,000 KES to buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La señora Rosaura es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años D. edad, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales solo uno está a su cargo, está casada y su esposo es maestro-jubilado.
Se dedica la venta D. prendas D. vestir y lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos que han sido muy aprovechados por que ha sabido invertir en la compra D. más mercadería.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 12 polos para hombres, 10 camisas, 6 pantalones D. vestir, 6 pantalones jean, 6 polos para damas, 3 faldas y 12 blusas.
Su hija es la que le ayuda en su negocio cuando tiene que salir a repartir los pedidos o hacer algunas compras, también recibe el apoyo D. su esposo.
Está muy agradecidas por la confianza y los préstamos recibidos.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 62 years old and has six children, only one of whom is in her care.  Rosaura is married and her husband is a retired teacher.

Rosaura sells clothes.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years and they have been very useful because she has invested them in buying more merchandise.  She will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 12 men's polo shirts, 10 shirts, 6 pairs of dress pants, 6 pairs of jeans, 6 women's polo shirts, 3 skirts and 12 blouses.

Rosaura's daughter helps her in her business when she has to go out and deliver orders or make some purchases.  She also has the support of her husband.  Rosaura is very grateful for the trust that has been placed in her and the loans that she has received.

loans.use: to buy a variety of men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  is a married woman with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members.  She has a bar and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last six years.  She sells her beer in the pub. 

Esther has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of  beer and jerrycans of local gin.  Her major business challenges include  the rainy season and defaulters.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group. She is 30 and married to a farmer. With her husband, she brings up two sons. The first son studies at school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds cattle and cultivates agricultural products. Nazira also sells milk every day to earn additional money. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing a washing machine. She wants to improve the family’s living conditions. In the future Nazira wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy a stock of dried fish to sell. Mansueta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Teresa, La socia tiene 57 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 3 hijos de 30, 28 y 20 años de edad, la socia es doce4nte de profesión de primaria, la socia paralelamente a esta actividad realiza trabajos hechos a mano como cerámica en frio, pintura en tela, tejidos de compras para bebes desde hace 7 años para la venta, manualidades varias y artesanía; La socia  requiere el crédito para comprar lanas, arcilla, pinturas para tela y para teñir la cerámica y realizar trabajos decorativos para la venta a sus amistades y público en general que aprecie el buen arte de este modo la socia tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar sus ganancias y poder pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos en la universidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas para chompas, pinturas, cerámica para realizar diversos trabajos y manualidades.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Maria Elena Moyano communal bank in Huanchac district, Cusco department and province.
Teresa, 57, is married and has 3 sons and daughters, 30, 28 and 20.  She is a primary school teacher and also does handicrafts such as modeled clay ceramics, painting on cloth, knit-ware for babies through 7 years, and she also sells various crafts and handiwork. 

She needs the loan to buy wool, clay, paints for cloth and ceramics.  She wants to do decorative work to sell to friends and the public in general who appreciate good art.  This will give her the opportunity to increase her earnings and be able to pay the school expenses of her children in the university  She is requesting financing to buy wool for sweaters, paints, and ceramics for different work and crafts.

loans.use: to buy wool for sweaters, paints and ceramics to do different crafts

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel. She is married with eight children. Evelyn has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase a variety of goods for resale. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, she hopes to have more income and savings from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for resale.

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Jun is 30 years old and single. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store business because of the poor quality of his life. He wishes to become one of the well-heeled men in the community, so he patiently sells cooking oil, breads, bath soap and soft drinks at his store.

He has been in this kind of occupation for two years and is hoping to increase his income by asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy butter for breads, salt, vinegar and canned goods as an additional source of profit in his store. He hopes to earn more for the betterment of his life and also to save for his future.

loans.use: to buy butter, salt, vinegar and canned goods.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 46 years old and married to Jesus. They were blessed with two kids. She considers a piggery business as a precious source of income because it provides their needs, especially the educational needs of her kids. She wants to expand her business and become one of the hog dealers in their community. 

Because of her willingness to survive and change their poor lifestyle, she never surrenders. She faces and fights poverty. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy three more pigs and feed. She hopes it will provide a better profit in order to afford all their every day needs without experiencing scarcity.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs and feed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three of them go to school. She has additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. Her other source of income is from rental houses .She has been in business for the last six years. 

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy second-hand clothes.  Her major business challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her inspiration goal is to build rental houses and also educate her children to university. Ruth lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and equipment for her rice mill business. 

 She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for rice mill maintenance.

loans.name: Somenea

texts.en:
Somenea, age 27, is a weaver. She earns $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns $3 per day. They have one child, five years old. Every month, she needs to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to pay for administration fees to work in Thailand. She wants to start a business raising animals at home so that she can earn additional income to help support the family.

loans.use: To pay for administration fees to work in Thailand so that she can start a new business

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 49 years old and is a widow with five children age 9 to 25. All of them are currently in school. 

She sells used clothes in a store she has been running for 15 years. 

Jeanette would like a loan to increase her inventory of used clothes. She will use any profits to pay school fees for her children and create a savings for her future. 

She would eventually like to become a wholesaler of used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Liborio

texts.es:
El Sr. Liborio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 51 años, está casado con la Sra. Norma de 40 años de edad. Ellos tienen un hijo, quien ya es mayor y se maneja de forma independiente.
 Don Liborio se dedica a la producción y venta de leche desde hace ya un tiempo. Gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto y sumado a la buena atención que da y la buena calidad de sus productos es que él ha podido crecer en su negocio y ampliarse. Nos cuenta que ya cuenta con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias. Es un señor muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción y tener más leche que vender.
texts.en:
Liborio is from the city of Santaní. He is 51 years old and is married to 40 year old Norma. They have a son who is already grown-up and lives independently. 
Liborio has been working for some time producing and selling milk. Thanks to the time that he has been doing this and the good care that he takes of his business and the good quality of his products, he has been able to grow and broaden his business. He tells us that he already has a loyal client base, good income, and good references. He is a very hardworking and enterprising man.
He is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow to augment his production and have more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Yekhaka Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Yekhaka Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Everlyne is the facilitator of Yekhaka group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Yekhaka group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en: Erdenebileg is 52 years old and lives with her husband in a Mongolian yurt and fence in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She has a four kids and they are all employed and live on their own. Her husband operates taxi service business. Erdenebileg operates meat trading business. She started her meat retailing business in 2000 by renting a counter in the market. She is very experienced on her field. She has many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to save up some supplies before prices hit their high point as they usually do. She is a sharp and hardworking women who says, "I have raised four children and I never had a chance to expand my business. Now that I have, I will concentrate on it. Also, we would like to purchase own house." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more meat at whole sale price.

loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Daru

texts.en:
Daru is 40 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school.  She operates a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan and has been in business for three years.

Daru is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Feliciano has provided motorcycle transport or "habal-habal" services for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his business. Feliciano is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loans.name: Marcia Thais

texts.es:
Marcia es un joven de 19 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad en la cual se produce uno de los licores bandera del Perú, el cual es el riquísimo “Pisco”. Marcia con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración , y para poder solventar sus gastos ella trabaja como secretaria en  una institución de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, asimismo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para sus gastos; ella cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy responsable, puntual y sobre todo realiza sus labores con cuidado.

Marcia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos ya que tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer y también podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser una buena profesional”.
texts.en:
Marcia, 19, is a young woman who lives in the city of Ica, where one of the most famous liqueurs in Peru, "Pisco", is produced.  Marcia is studying hard to complete her Business Administration degree and works as a secretary at a local high school to cover her expenses.  She works eight hours a day and is able to help her parents with household expenses.  She also has a small business selling beauty products, which gives her extra money for her personal use.  She believes business is doing well because she is very responsible, punctual and, above all, meticulous in her work.

Marcia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to buy merchandise for her small beauty products business.  This will allow her to improve her income since she will have a wider variety of goods to offer.  She will also be able to continue working toward her biggest goal, which is:  "To finish her degree and be a good professional".

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as lipstick, creams, eyeshadows, etc.

loans.name: Shatha's Group

texts.en:
Shatha is a member of this group from Iraq Shatha, is a 56 years old widow and mother of one. After her husband death she had hard time to support herself. Shatha started selling clothes and home products from home to support her family. 
When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widow women she took a loan to buy more products and sell it. She is aiming to increase business.
The story of Shatha and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic developments clients.
They preferred to blur their faces for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Shatha's Group's 3,000 loan helped a member to purchase more products.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kouéba Marguerite (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 59 ans. Kouéba Marguerite a très peu fréquenté l'école. Kouéba Marguerite est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Kouéba Marguerite vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Kouéba Marguerite vend des produits vivriers et du sodabi (boisson locale), ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Kouéba Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Kouéba Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits vivriers et du sodabi.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Nueva Victoria Group

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven de 22 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de un hijo de dos años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Blanca para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, con esta actividad lleva 10 años de realizarlo, gracias a sus habilidades ha conseguido  elaborar hermosos atuendos típicos. Blanca gracias a su amabilidad ha conseguido mucha clientela por esa razón solicita un préstamo para comprar productos de ropa típica como fajas, cortes y güipiles. Su gran sueño es contar con un negocio mejor acreditado y contar con un local propio.

loans.use: Compra de ropa típica como: fajas, cortes y güipiles.

loans.name: Siakou

texts.en:
Mr. Siakou L. is a renowned mechanic in the N’kafu area where he opened his workshop. Approximately 38 years old, Siakou is married and has three children. Very calm and having mastered his business, Siakou and his four apprentices are highly sought after because of the quality of their work and the warm welcome they give to their customers. Very rigorous in adminstrative matters, Siakou has proven himself to be a man of honesty and trust with respect to his three previous loans which were paid back regularly without incident.

To increase and develop his business, Siakou is asking for a loan of $2000 to buy a new machine and some small equipment. This will increase his revenue and his income, which will allow him to ensure the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur L. Siakou est un vulgarisateur de renom dans le quartier N’kafu où il a ouvert son atelier. Agé de 38 ans environs, Siakou est marié et père de trois enfants.
