Très calme et maîtrisant très bien ses activités, Siakou avec ses quatre apprentis est très sollicité à cause de la qualité de ses prestations et de l’accueil très chaleureux qu’il réserve à sa clientèle. Très rigoureux en matière de gestion, il a fait preuve d’un homme d’honnêteté et de confiance à travers ses trois crédits déjà obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident.

Pour accroître et développer ses activités, Siakou sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour acheter une nouvelle machine et de petit outillage. Ce qui augmentera son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus qui lui permettront d’assurer le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and some small tools/equipment

loans.name: Ulpiah

texts.en: U. is 30 years old and is married with two children. Both are girls. She manages duck livestock. She buys baby ducks and then raises them until they become bigger. She sells duck for $4 each. She can earn more income in the festive seasons. Her husband, Anwar, is a bus driver, earning $4 per day. She very much needs to get a $50 loan to buy more ducks. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Duck livestock

loans.name: Agbessi

texts.en:
At 37 years of age, Mrs. Agbessi G. is married and has four (4) children, none of whom are in school. Her farmer husband, out of work due to the poor quality of his soil, is another person whose care she is in charge of. To survive, Mrs. G. started a small business of fried fish which she sells throughout the village and neighbouring markets. Having become the real head of the family, she does her job with passion and self-sacrifice, and generates income to meet the basic needs of her family. Mrs. G. wants to make her business more profitable by extending to other areas where she is asked for.

She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy with cash (and hence very cheaply) oil, firewood, and fresh fish in large quantities in order to meet the market demand. This loan will contribute to improving the living conditions of Mrs. G. and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans Mme G. Agbessi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants tous non scolarisés. Son mari cultivateur sans activités à cause de la pauvreté de ses sols, consiste une autre charge pour elle. Pour survivre, Mme G. s’est adonné au petit commerce de poissons fris qu’elle revend dans les quartiers et dans les marchés environnants. Devenu véritable chef de famille, elle exerce avec passion et abnégation ce métier d’où elle tire tout le revenu pour subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de la famille. Mme G. veut rentabiliser d’avantage son activité en conquérant d’autres localités où elle est sollicitée. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter comptant et donc très moins cher, l’huile, le bois de chauffe et les poissons frais en grande quantité afin de couvrir la demande sur le marché. Ce crédit contribuera à améliorer les conditions de vie de Mme G. et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, fry, and re-sell fish

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena G. B., 18, weaves traditional Mayan clothes. She lives in Nebaj, where all the women in her family make huipiles, the beautiful woman's top with woven designs of birds and trees. She can make two huipiles in a month and see them for US$200 up to $250. She sells to other women in the town who are looking for fresh clothes of this type.

Elena will use this loan to buy yarn and also to buy some products for the small store she and her mother are trying to expand. The ultimate goal is to expand the little store into a well-stocked general store.

Elena is still working on her schooling - she's in Junior High school and goes every Sunday for the weekend program. She hopes to finish her high school specialization in the next 3-4 years.

Her dad died four months ago after a four-year battle with tuberculosis, so Elena has to help with her younger siblings. Her sister is particularly sad right now, perhaps having a hard time understanding the death of their father.

Elena speaks and can read and write Spanish in addition to her native Ixil, the local Mayan language.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is thirty six years old and married with three children.  He started his business by selling clothes in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loan, he added some shoes and plastic sandals.  He is requesting a further loan of $175 to purchase inventory.  His wife is also expected to join the business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Naiden

texts.en: Naiden N. lives in the village of Medkovetz. He works in the nearby town of Vratza, where he and his parents have a farm. More specifically, they breed cows. At present, they have three cows. His parents are retired and take care of the stock. Naiden and his parents need to buy fodder for the winter period and are applying for a $750 loan so that they can do so.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for the winter period

loans.name: Abdukhamid

texts.en: Abdukhamid B. lives in Mastchokh and he is married with two children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he recommends himself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. B. has a business in agricultural products (vegetables) selling onions, potatoes, carrots, etc. He is the direct supplier which allows him to sell the vegetables at a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his goods. Abdukhamid B. is very experienced in his business. But working in the trade sphere he meets hard competitors which is why he wants to widen his existing assortment. Now Mr. B. requires a loan of 2400 STJ to develop his business and widen his assortment of goods.

loans.use: Abdukhamid would like to develop his business development and widen his assortment of goods for his vegetable business.

loans.name: Edos

texts.en: Madam Edo is a union leader in LAPO; she is 52 years old and married with four children. She owns a restaurant for the sales of drinks and pepper soup. She is a Bini by tribe. She is asking for the loan amount of $450 to buy more crate sof drinks for sale. She started the business in 1991.

loans.use: To buy crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Yadira Justina

texts.es:
Yadira D. has been teaching children for 10 years in a small school in the region of El Sauce in the beautiful city of Leon. She is married and has two school-aged children and a little one on the way. Yadira's efforts are all towards providing the best for her little ones and even though she is pregnant she continues to teach in the school.

Yadira's urgent need is to rebuild part os her home as it is in a state of disrepair - the walls are damaged, the floors are cracked, holes in the roof - she sees no way to stay in her home in its current condition, especially when the baby is born. Given the situation Yadira has sought out the help of Ceprodel to acquire a loan with which she will purchase bricks, cement, roof tiling, wood and to pay for the labour required to rebuild her home in time for her baby's birth.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Yadira D. es una dama que desde hace 10 años se dedica a impartir clases a niños en un pequeño colegio del municipio El sauce en la bella ciudad de León. Es madre casada con dos hijos en edad escolar y uno pronto de nacer. La señora Yadira asegura que sus esfuerzos son para brindarles lo mejor a sus pequeños y a pesar de su estado de embarazo, ella continua impartiendo clases en el colegio.

La necesidad de la señora Yadira es la urgencia de reconstruir su casa de habitación por lo que se encuentra en mal estado, las paredes dañadas, el piso quebradizo, el techo con huecos y no puede de ninguna manera estar en estas condiciones en el momento que su bebé nazca. Consiente de esta situacion la señora Yadira ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con los créditos que le permiten invertir en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, tejas, madera y pago de la mano de obra para remodelar su hogar y prestar mejores condiciones para cuando su hijo nazca.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks, cement, roof tiling, wood, and labour wages

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 50 year old married woman with 5 children, ages 25, 23, 20, 18 and 14. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 26 and 25. Evelyn sells cloth and alcoholic beverages, a business she started in 2000. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $480.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Akouvi Bijou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akouvi Bijou A. was born on November 12, 1959 in Agoè-Nyivé, which is located 12 kilometers from Lomé. She is married and the mother of one child. Her primary business venture is selling charcoal. Her husband works as a driver and helps her with transporting the sacks of charcoal. Mrs. Akouvi Bijou A. started up her charcoal business in 1997 and has regular sources she buys from. She sells wholesale and retail, according to the deliveries she receives.

This first loan that she is requesting in the amount of US$ 500 will allow her to purchase 22 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akouvi Bijou est née le 12 novembre 1959 à Agoè-Nyivé, localité située à 12 km de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale le commerce de charbon de bois. Son mari qui est un chauffeur l’aide dans le transport de sacs de charbon. Madame A. Akouvi Bijou a démarré cette activité depuis 1997 et a des fournisseurs réguliers. Elle vend en gros et en détail selon les livraisons qu’elle a reçues.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’une valeur de 200.000 FCFA lui permettra acheter 22 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 22 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 22 sacs de charbons

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 28 years old, and has been running a transport business. He is also involved in the purchase and sales of wood. Jose is married but they still have no children. He works alongside his wife in both their businesses.

He transports agricultural products with his truck, but he purchases wood in the country and sells it to carpenters in the community where he lives. He has been running these businesses for 8 years. There is a great deal of competition for this field of work which is great for Jose because he has earned a steady clientele.

With this loan he will purchase a new vehicle. This is his eighth loan with his institution and he has demonstrated commitment to meeting his payments in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

José de 28 años de edad, se dedica hacer fletes en camión y también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Actualmente José se encuentra casado pero aún no tiene niños, él trabaja junto a su esposa en sus dos actividades. Realiza fletes de productos agrícolas en su camión, en cuanto a la madera la compra en el campo y la vende a los aserraderos que se encuentran en la comunidad donde vive. En este rubro ya tiene una experiencia de 8 años. Existe competencia pero lo que le favorece a José es que ya cuenta con clientes fijos. Con la presente solicitud el reintegrará a su presupuesto que tenía fijado para la compra de un vehículo. Esta es la octava secuencia de Jose con la institución y demostró un buen cumplimiento con sus pagos.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo B. was born in 1974 in Khujand, Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. MicroInvest has worked with Mrs. B. since 2003 and she has not any problems repaying her previous loans. Mrs. B. has been working since she was 14, when she helped her mother to sell household goods. Thanks to her previous loan, she started her own business, and now she sells children’s wear. She has a good assortment and many repeat customers.

Now Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1200 US for 6 months to expand her trade outlet.

loans.use: To expand her trade outlet

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana is 20 years old and is a teacher, work which she is very dedicated to because she likes to transmit and teach the knowledge she has acquired throughout her years.

Married and with two children who are students, her husbandworks as a network operator in an office in Managua. The constant rains of this past winter came into her home and the roof is now in very poor shape. This is why she is asking for a loan so she can repair part of the roof and in this way stop the rain from continuing to come into her home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Diana tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la docencia, trabajo que realiza con mucha dedicación porque le gusta transmitir sus conocimientos adquiridos a través del tiempo. Es casada, tiene 2 hijos estudiantes, su esposo trabaja como operador de redes en una empresa de managua. Las constantes lluvias de este invierno están entrando en su casa debido a que el techo seencuentra en mal estado, por eso solicita el préstamo para reparar parte del techo y así evitar que el agua le siga entrando a suvivienda.

loans.use: Repairing the roof of her home

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.es:
Jeanina is a member of the Good Luck Community Bank. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner and has two daughters. She makes a living selling educational materials for children, school supplies and other novel products to teachers and parents of students. She acquires her products from the city of Lima.

Jeanina has plans to open a multi-service shop where she will sell school supplies, glassware, toys, gifts and snacks. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles ($700), which she will use to invest in the purchase of glasses, dishes, notebooks, ballpoint pens, paper and various gifts.

Jeanina's dreams are to make headway with her daughters, for her business to grow, to get married and have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Jeanina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Jeanina es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijas, Jeanina vende materiales didácticos de niños, útiles y otros productos novedosos, que ofrece a los profesores y padres de familias de los colegios, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Jeanina tiene proyectado aperturar una tienda multiservicios donde venderá útiles de escritorio, cristalería, juguetes, artículos de regalos y golosinas.

Jeanina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos, juego de vajilla, cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y regalos variados.

Los sueños de Jeanina son sacar adelante a sus hijas, que su negocio crezca, casarse y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Jeanina is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles ($700), which she will use to invest in the purchase of glasses, dishes, notebooks, ballpoint pens, paper and various gifts / Jeanina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos, juego de vajilla, cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y regalos variados.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Victoria es separada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Victoria vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Wari Accopampa, Victoria viaja a 5 ferias de la región, en días distintos, en donde vende mantas, abarrotes variados y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, que luego de acopiar traslada a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mantas, azúcar, arroz, fideos. Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales mejores que ella, mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Victoria is 43 years old and separated, with three children. She lives in a home that she rents in the Wari Accopampa neighborhood. Victoria travels to five different markets in the region, each on a different day. She sells blankets and various groceries at the markets, and buys grains and cheese, which she brings back to Ayacucho. Victoria then sells these products to the local merchants of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles which she'll use to buy blankets, sugar, rice, and noodles. Victoria dreams of her children growing up to be better professionals than herself, of improving her business and of owning her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles which she'll use to buy blankets, sugar, rice, and noodles.

loans.name: Malai

texts.en:
Malai M. (shown in the picture with her mother), 26, is single and lives with her parents. She has one brother and three sisters. Her brother is a driver, two of her sisters are in school, and one sister is a garment factory worker. The family lives along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Malai has been a garment factory worker for four years. She has been selling clothes that she creates for two years now. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells foodstuffs like gari, yams, pepper, etc. in her shop located at Ilufe Road in Lagos State, Nigeria. Bola is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Bola is a LAPO client. Because of the growing demands on her foodstuffs and her inability to meet the demands of her customers, she needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She expresses her profound gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for affecting lives positively.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to re-sell

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es: La Sr. Hilda tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, con cuatros hijos de 3, 12, 14 y 16 años de edad,  tres hijos los tiene estudiando en colegio del barrio. Habitantes de barrio memorial Sandino de la capital de Managua. Su esposo trabaja en acarreo ubicado en un mercado de la capital. Posee una pequeña pulpería en donde vende  granos básicos, golosina verduras, frutas, pollo entre otros productos con dos años de experiencia en ventas, inicio su negocio con capital propio. Sus planes son  tener solides en su negocio y retomar la comercialización de cacahuate vendiéndola en la pulpería y otros puntos de la capital siendo un distribuidor del producto. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes se lograran y le dará a sus hogar una mejor comodidad, la expansión de su negocio y la seguridad de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 34 years old and married with four children of 3, 12, 14 and 16 years of age. Three of her children study at the local school. They live in the Sandino district of the capital Managua. Her husband works in transportation at a market in the capital. Hilda owns a grocery store where she sells grains, candies, fruit, vegetables and chicken among others. She has two years’ experience in sales; started her business with her own capital. She plans to solidify her business and take on the sales of peanuts again, sell it in her shop and at various points of the city as a distributor. Owing to the Afodenic loans, she could achieve her plans, could make her home more comfortable, expand her business and improve the security of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Torn's Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which is located in Phum Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province, consists of eighteen people who will each use the loan that they obtain for different purposes.  

Mr. Torn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.  He owns a small grocery store in the local market.  Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it.  So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for his inventory.  His wife, Mrs. Yun Soky, helps him in the current business. 

Mr. Torn S. is 43 years old and the father of five children who are all attending the local school.
 
All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for his inventory.

loans.name: Bolivia Unida Group

texts.es: La asociación "Bolivia Unida" esta en su primer ciclo y la presidenta es la señora Maria Roxana  la misma que se dedica a la venta D. libros, algunos D. los socios ya trabajaron anteriormente con grupos solidarios por lo que poseen la experiencia necesaria para el cumplimiento D. los pagos. Dentro D. este grupo existe la presencia D. dos varones  además los socios se dedican a las siguientes actividades: venta D. cosméticos, a la tramitación D. papeles judiciales independientes, comercio D. la coca legal, venta D. ropa, venta D. partes para computadoras, atención D. taller D. metal mecánica venta D. ropa para niños, venta D. calzados en las ferias D. la ciudad D. El Alto. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. materia prima e insumos para la producción, también para la compra o reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The "United Bolivia" group is in its first loan cycle and its president is Maria Roxana, who sells books. Some of the members worked together previously in other solidarity groups and have the experience needed to meet their repayments. Within the group are two men. The members are involved in the following activities: cosmetic sales, processing of legal paperwork, legal sale of coca leaves, sale of clothing, sale of computer parts, metal mechanic workshop, sale of children´s clothing, sale of footwear in the markets in El Alto. This loan will be used to buy materials and supplies for production as well as to buy or repair work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Pesseri

texts.fr: Pesseri P. est une jeune femme de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Il faut noter que la vue est prise sur la terrasse de leur maison. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Lomé. Elle espère avec ce crédit, louer un magasin pour stocker ses marchandises afin d’éviter la rupture de stocks et aussi s’approvisionner pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Cette chance lui permettra de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients.
texts.en:
Pesseri P. is a young woman of 32, married and the mother of 2 children. Note that the photo was taken on the terrace of their home. She sells cereals at the big open-air market of Lomé. She hopes with this loan to rent a storeroom to keep her merchandise in so as to avoid running short and also to stock up so as to satisfy the needs of her customers. This opportunity will allow her to better respond to the demand from her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase sacks of maize, millet, and beans for re-sale

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan lives in Khachmaz town. He is 27 years old and single. Three years ago he started in the dairy business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Binta

texts.en: Binta sells cooked foods like rice, beans, eba, etc. She hopes to expand this business. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is 38 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Madame G. Akoélé est veuve avec quatre enfants à charge. Née en 1954 à Glidji ; cette brave femme s’est lancée dans le commerce produits vivriers il y a très longtemps. Activités qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement. En effet elle va de marché en marché pour acheter des céréales (maïs, haricots, mil) qu’elle stocke et revend à ses nombreux clients. Compte tenu de la charge qu’elle assure toute seule, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande de ses clients et ses revenues tendent à chuter. Elle sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer et rentabiliser son activité. Akoélé est veuve avec quatre enfants à charge. Née en 1954 à Glidji ; cette brave femme s’est lancée dans le commerce produits vivriers il y a très longtemps. Activités qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement. En effet elle va de marché en marché pour acheter des céréales (maïs, haricots, mil) qu’elle stocke et revend à ses nombreux clients. Compte tenu de la charge qu’elle assure toute seule, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande de ses clients et ses revenues tendent à chuter. Elle sollicite donc un crédit pour renforcer et rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. G. Akoélé is a widow and has four children to support. Born in 1954 in Glidji, this good and honest woman got started in the commerce of staple goods a very long time ago. It's a business she has perfectly mastered. She basically go from market to market to buy grain (corn, beans, millet) that she stocks and resells to her numerous customers. Given the responsibilities she is shouldering by herself, she can no longer satisfy the demands of her customers, and her revenues are tending to drop. She's therefore requesting a loan to bolster her business and make it profitable.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell grain

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch C., 41, and her husband, Mr. Senghai Kheng, 45, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1992 and have two children: one son is in primary school and one daughter who is in grade 11 and who also assists her mother in her weaving business when she has free time.

Touch has been a silk weaver for twenty-three years. It’s a skill she learned from her aunt. Her husband is a bicycle repairer. She hopes to set up one more loom for her daughter to use to get more extra income so she is applying for a loan of $400 to use for this purpose and to buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and to set up one more loom for her daughter to weave.

loans.name: Chulduzoy

texts.ru: Хаитова Чулдузой- женщина 41 лет. Замужем имеет 4-х детей. Чулдузой занимается откормом скота. У неё 60 коз и 2 овца. Её помогает муж и старшая дочка.Чулдузой дополнительно занимается переработкой пряжи и вязанием шерстяных вещей а её муж продаёт на рынке Чоркута. На полученный займ  хочет купить овец и козы. Чулдузой очень внимательная женщина так она прокармливает свою семью.
texts.en:
Chulduzoy H. is a 41 year old married woman with 4 children. Her main occupation is animal farming. She has 60 goats and 2 sheep. Both her husband and her oldest daughter help her with this. In addition, Chulduzoy processes wool and knits various clothing, which her husband sells at a market "Chorkuta". Using Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional goats and sheep. Chulduzoy is a very responsible woman who provides for her family.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo”, vive en el Psje. Callao Nº 150, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos: 02 mujeres y 01 varón.

Con el fin de implementar y ampliar su negocio; ya que se dedica al alquiler  de habitacionres, puso mucho empeño para seguir adelante, y cumplir con las metas que se propuso.
Nos cuenta que anteriormente contaba con el apoyo de su esposo y después que falleció sufrió mucho pero nunca se dejo vencer y tuvo que salir adelante sola, para poder dar estudios a sus tres hijos y cumplir con lo que se propuso. Poco a poco, fue mejorando y construyendo sus habitaciones  para su respectivo alquiler.
Hoy en día se siente muy contenta con lo logrado, genera sus propios ingresos mensuales.

Ahora cuenta con 05 cuartos, que los alquila a estudiantes y docentes, le conviene mucho ya que vive cerca de una universidad. Hoy continúa con el mismo negocio ubicado en su misma casa.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará materiales de construcción, como: 02 sacos de cemento y arena, para mejorar su pasadizo y bolsas de pintura para darle una mejor decoración. 

Rosa, tiene carisma, es alegre y es amiga de sus clientes, tiene confianza con ellos y son puntuales con sus pagos.
Comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank “Women Bound for Development”, and she lives in the Morales District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She is widowed, 54 years old, and has 3 children: 2 girls and 1 boy. Rosa dedicates herself to renting out rooms, and with the aim of expanding her business she puts a lot a work into continuing to get ahead and reaching the goals that she has set for herself. She tells us that she had previously relied on the support of her husband, and when he passed away she suffered greatly but never allowed it to defeat her. She had to move forward alone to provide her three children with an education and to fulfill the goals that she set for herself. Little by little, she continued improving and building her rooms to then rent. Today she feels very happy with what she has accomplished, and generates her own monthly income. Currently she has 5 rooms that she rents to students and university lecturers; this is very convenient given that she lives near the university. At present she continues in this same business located in her own home. With this loan of 1,800 PEN she will purchase construction materials, such as: 2 cement and sand bags to improve her passageway, and paint to improve the decor. Rosa has charisma, is happy, and is a friend to her clients, she has their trust and they are punctual with their payments. She comments that the Manual Ramos Movement as organization helps women to develop and progress with the same opportunities as men.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to improve her rooms for rent.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena M. tiene la edad de 40 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que su Mama le enseño este oficio, y a Martha le gusto este medio de supervivencia por lo que decide comenzar a fabricar vestidos y trajes formales, al inicio no poseía muchos clientes por lo que con mucho esfuerzo se gano la confianza de cada uno de sus clientes, y fue así que sus clientes poseían mas confianza para hablar de sus trajes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de telas, tijeras, alfileres entre otras cosas. El sueño de Martha es establecer un taller para proporcionar trabajos a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena M. is 40 years old and has two children in her care who are in school. She makes a living providing seamstress services. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She started this activity because her mother taught her this trade and Martha likes this way of making a living, She decided to begin making dresses and formal wear. At the beginning she did not have many customers, but through a lot of effort she has gained the confidence of each one of her customers and they are more comfortable talking to her regarding their gowns. The purpose of the loan is to increase her working capital, purchase fabrics, scissors, pins and other such items. Martha dreams of opening her own shop and being able to provide work for persons that need it.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 68-year-old woman; she is married with eight children. All her children are currently working. She is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation to help her husband support the family as she is old and not active in hard work.

Ama owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets in her community and has been selling items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. for twelve years now. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda B. une femme veuve de 64ans. Elle fait du commerce de crème glace et de rafraîchissants, activité très rentable en cette période de forte canicule. Elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Aïda B. is a 64-year-old widow. She runs an ice cream and refreshments business, which is very profitable in this heat wave. She would like to develop her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell refreshments and ice cream

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: bineta M. est une societaire parent beneficiaire depuis 1994.elle s'exerce dans le domaine de la fripperie et capitalise une experience de dix ans dans cet activite.elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour elargir son marche et accroitre ses benefices pour mieux faire face a ses responsabilites familiales car c'est une femme qui contribue beaucoup a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bineta M. has been a recipient parent member since 1994. She operates in the domain of second-hand clothing and capitalizes on ten years of experience in this business. She’s requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to expand her market and to grow her profits in order to cope better with family responsibilities, since she’s a woman who does a lot to look after her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a son. She lives and works in Novomoskovsk, a town in the south-eastern part of Ukraine.

Tatyana sells multiple-glazed units, vinyl windows and doors and launched this enterprise three years ago. She owns a small office in downtown Novomoskovsk next to a busy bus station. She already makes 65,000 Grivnyas in gross income.

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 10,400 Grivnyas to further develop and expand her business, introducing new kinds of merchandise.

Tatyana's small business is well known in her town and the region for high quality plastic extrusions and reasonable pricing policy. This type of merchandise is in good demand which encourages her to develop her small venture even further.

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Mrs. Nhor S. is a villager in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She is a 50-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a cow middleman, while another is employed in a government department, and the third is a construction worker. Mrs. Nhor S. is applying for a loan to buy three more cows for her first child’s business.

loans.use: to buy three more cows for her first child’s business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de León, la señora Dolores Velasquez se dedica a vender tamales los que son elaborados por ella misma y ofrecidos en el mercado con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Ella requiere de la compra del maíz, la leña y la cal para elaborar los tamales y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito y de esta manera continuar mejorando su condición económica en su actividad.

loans.use: Compra de maíz, leña y cal

loans.name: Elizabeth Akinyi

texts.en:
Elizabeth Akinyi is forty years old, married to Stephen Otieno, and a mother of five. She has been selling cereals in Kibuye, an open air market situated about 20 kilometres from Kisumu City, for the last two years.

She has been a member of an informal women's group, who assisted her with the start-up capital for her business. Elizabeth learned about KADET Ltd through a co-member in the women's group who is an existing client of KADET Ltd.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use her loan to increase stock in preparation for the December festive season, when the region receives many visitors from the main cities.

She hopes to purchase and develop a plot of land in the neighborhood. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals in preparation for December's high season

loans.name: 25 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo “25 D. Agosto” esta representado por la señora Mary Luz y conformado por 12 miembros, son personas muy activas y con ganas D. trabajar para salir adelante en cada uno D. sus negocios por ejemplo la presidenta se dedica a  la elaboración y distribución D. pan empezando a trabajar desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana; al igual que ella el resto D. las integrantes del grupo son muy dedicadas a su trabajo ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. En general las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, cosméticos y golosinas. Dentro del ámbito D. venta D. comida existe mucha competencia pero lo importante en este negocio es el sabor D. la comida, es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo para ampliar sus puestos D. ventas D. comida y para la adquisición D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Un 70% D. las socias ya  cuentan con experiencia en grupo solidarios pero están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital que creen en el grupo para salir adelante.
Capital D. Operaciones
texts.en:
The group “25 D. Agosto” (25th of August) is represented by Mary Luz and maD. up of 12 members, all of whom are active people with the desire to work to get ahead in each of their businesses. For example, the group's president makes and distributes bread, beginning work in the early hours of the morning. Just like her, the rest of the group's members are very dedicated to their work, as they have to be since their families' upkeep depends on it. In general the group sells food, cosmetics and sweets. There is a lot of competition in the field of food sales but the most important thing in this business is the taste of the food, which is why the group require a loan to extend their food sales outlets and to purchase the supplies and tools that will help to generate more income and in turn improve their families' quality of life. 70% of the group's members already have experience in community groups and are very satisfied with the support that the Agrocapital foundation offers them and their faith in the group to move forward. The group plan to use the loan for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita J. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 47 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Lolita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to purchase construction materials for house improvement. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital and to purchase construction materials for house improvement

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 20-year-old single man. He has been working as an electrician since 2006 to began a new career and earn his own income. Today, Hassan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more tools and electric cable to improve his business.

loans.use: buy more tools and electric cable

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon L. is from the village of Danao. He is 33 years old and is single. Marlon owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Marlon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with one grown up daughter. She sells various construction supplies at a downtown market in the city of Zaporozhye. She has been in this business for seven years. She offers good quality products at affordable prices and this factor, as well as a good location, has brought Irina many repeat clients.

Irina would like to borrow 8,700 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and be able to help her daughter financially.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Mrs. Yee Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Kbal Kaoh village in the Kandal province. Mrs. Yee S. is the village-bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Sorn OUn, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field for cultivating rice and vegetables. 

On their farm, they face a problem because their field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Yee S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support their crops. She is 36 years old and the mother of seven children. One of her children is employed in the garment factory, another is a laborer, three are attending the local school and the remaining children are too young to work or study. 

Mrs. Khom B. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Shayinbubu's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is one of the famous towns of Kyrgyzstan where people have a good time, mostly in the summer because it is on the coast of Kyrgyzstan's beautiful lake, Issyk–Kyl. Although there is unemployment, the citizens of Balykchy mostly sell fish and goods in the markets, and thus they live. 

However, some of them are really hardworking people. One of them is Shayinbubu S., who is a thirty-year-old young lady. She is married and has a son, age five. Her husband is a self-employed taxi driver. Both husband and son help Shayinbubu in her business. Together they sell clothes in the market. With the profit they have bought a car. They thank God that all their troubled days are in the past. 

In the beginning, when it was really hard even to have bread daily, they did not crack. Instead they were determined to find a way out of that situation. About five years ago, for 5,000 KGS ($115), Shayinbubu bought a sewing machine, and little by little she started her business. She was sewing national items and selling them until they got a loan from Mol Bulak Finance. Now she has shifted from making national items to trading clothes. Now she sells women's and men's pants, and she sells apples in the summer. She is planning to buy a big new house and provide education for her son as well. Her monthly profit is about 11,000 KGS ($250). She wants a loan to buy a spring assortment of clothes for both females and males, and to sell the clothes in remote districts on weekends.

Ayzat S. is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman who has two children. Her husband works as the driver of a lorry. His salary is 4,000 KGS ($89). Her elder son is nine and goes to school. Her daughter is five and she attends kindergarten.  Ayzat works at the post office and earns 2,500 KGS ($55). They are planning to buy furniture and educate their children. With the loan they are requesting, they want to buy curtains for their house.

Rakyia B. is a married woman. She is thirty-nine years old and they have four children; two daughters and two sons. The older son attends school, as do their two daughters, but the youngest child is at home. The older daughter helped her mother distribute goods which were bought with saved money (5,000 KGS ($112), and later on the business was expanded and increased among the companies. Her elder daughter graduated from a specialized school. They want a loan to buy a foal and to re-do their house. In the future they are planning to buy a house, a car and give education to their children.

Mednina S. is a young lady who is twenty-four years old and has two children. She is married, and her husband works at a construction company. A year ago, when she started her business with 2,000 KGS ($45), she and her sister were selling half-built houses. Now her revenue is about 4,000 KGS ($90). She wants to buy her own house because she lives with her relatives now. She wants a loan to invest, and with the profits she wants to make her dream come true.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a spring assortment of clothes to sell

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny S. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.50-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice.

In this farming, Mrs. Vanny S. faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her field. Thus she decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming.

Mrs. Vanny S. is the mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other three are students in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Parng Sun, is a fish seller from which he makes a small income to support his family living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La alegría y perseverancia es lo que caracteriza a Rita, tiene 44 años, vive junto a su esposo Leoncio de 48 años y sus cinco hijos en su hermosa y acogedora vivienda ubicada en la plaza principal de su localidad.

Ella asegura que es capaz de vender todo lo que llega a sus manos, pues es una buena comerciante que atiende con amabilidad a sus clientes. Lleva 17 años dedicada al negocio de venta de comestibles en un espacio de su casa, donde también aprovecha para ofrecer jugos y extractos de frutas. Rita empieza su labor a las 4 de la mañana y lo prolonga hasta las 11 de la noche y para que su bodega esté siempre surtida con productos de pan llevar, todos los jueves viaja a la ciudad, donde encuentra verduras a precios rebajados. Adicionalmente, hace algunos días atrás mandó  a construir un horno artesanal donde elabora unos deliciosos panes que también vende en su tienda.
Por otro lado, su esposo cultiva café, palta, plátanos y maíz para que cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y solventar la educación de sus hijos, también está ahorrando porque más adelante piensa reconstruir su casa de material noble.  

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y presiente que de ahora en adelante sus objetivos se consolidarán porque confía en su voluntad de trabajo junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes la invitaron ser socia de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una refrigeradora para empezar a vender carne de carnero, cerdo y pollo, además de condimentos molidos y chupetes.
texts.en:
Joy and perseverance are what characterize Rita. She is 44 years old and lives with her husband Leoncio (age 48) and their five children. They have a beautiful cozy home located in the main square of town.

Rita claims that she can sell anything that touches her hands. She is an excellent merchant who attends to her customers with kindness. For 17 years, she has managed her grocery business from a space in her house where she also offers juices and fruit extracts. Rita begins her work at 4am and continues until 11pm so that her store is always stocked with baked goods. Every Thursday, she travels to the city where she buys vegetables at reduced prices. A few days ago, she had an oven built so that she could produce delicious handmade breads to sell in her shop. Meanwhile, her husband grows coffee, avocados, bananas, and corn to cover their living expenses and pay for their children’s education. Rita is also saving money because she is planning to rebuild her house out of solid materials.

This is her first loan with MFP. Rita feels that she can move forward with her objectives because she is willing to work with the other members of her Communal Bank, who invited her to become a member of the group. With the money that was requested, she will purchase a refrigerator so that she can begin selling meat such as mutton, pork, and chicken, as well as ground condiments and popsicles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: María Rina

texts.es:
La señora María Rina C. se desempeña como maestra de primaria y trabaja en la escuela Marcos Dessys  en la Ciudad de Chinandega, es casada y tiene 1 hijos uno menor de edad habita en el Reparto Libertad.

La señora María Rina solicitó el crédito para gastos personales servicios básicos y para ayudarle a sus padres con medicinas ya que el papá se encuentra enfermo y pagar deudas.
texts.en:
María Rina C. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys school in Chinandega. She is married, lives in the Reparto Libertad area, and has one dependent child. María Rina is requesting a loan to cover her personal expenses, household expenses, repay some debts, and help her parents with their medical expenses since her father is sick.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover personal expenses, household expenses, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Teresa is widowed. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Teresa's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aura

texts.es: Aura tiene 57 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 20 años se dedica en la venta de carne de cerdo frito, negocio que tiene como nombre Chicharrón, plato típico de la ciudad. Desde entonces sus clientes acuden a su establecimiento a consumir este rico platillo, lo que motiva a Aura a quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche y al día siguiente realizar las compras necesarias para su siguiente venta que se inicia en las tardes. Con estos años de experiencia, Aura ha logrado tener logros y eso lo anima a continuar adelante con su negocio e implementarlo con mejor herramientas. Este es su diecisieteavo crédito con MFP, y como fundadora de su grupo comunal, promete en ser puntual con sus pagos. Además considera que este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cubiertos y platos nuevos, así como de gaseosas y cervezas para complementar su servicio.
texts.en:
Aura is 57 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home with her two children. For more than 20 years she has been selling fried pork (known as “chicharrón”), which is a traditional dish of the city. Her customers come to her establishment to eat her tasty dishes, which motivates her to stay late into the night and into the following morning to continue making sales. She then reopens her business in the afternoon. With her years of experience, Aura has achieved success and is encouraged to continue forward with her business and establish it with better equipment.

This is her seventeenth loan with MFP. As one of the founding members of her Communal Bank, Aura promises to be punctual with her payments. She considers this loan to be very useful in advancing her business. The funds she requested will be invested in cutlery and new dishes, as well as sodas and beer to complement her food service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cutlery, dishes, sodas, and beer

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of M. A. and the mother of five children. They all live together in a small house of two rooms where they have lived for the past thirty years. Her first two sons are involved in a vegetable selling business. Her daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education.  
Her husband operates a grocery shop in the community. He selected this business because of his four years of sales experience. He opens his shop in the morning at 8 o’clock and closes it at 9pm. Salma also helps him by spending time in his grocery shop with him. In this way they handle the clients and increase the income. The income helps them to manage the financial expenses and to pay the education fees of their kids. 
Salma is applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah. The funds will be used to invest in capital for the grocery shop so they can purchase the groceries in bulk and increase the profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Mileidy

texts.es: Mileidy C. J., tiene la edad de 24 años, está soltera, y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene 5 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche . La idea es tener ganado con producción de leche para consumo propio y para venderla  en la comunidad y así maximizar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Mileidy trabaja desde hace unos años con ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y sobre todo como productora.
texts.en:
Mileidy C. J. is 24 years old and single. She has one child, who is her greatest priority. He is five years old. She wants the loan to buy a dairy cow. The idea is to have livestock that produce milk for their own consumption and to sell in the community. This will maximize her earnings. This is her first loan with Fudecosur. She is very happy with the terms of the loan she got. Mileidy has worked with livestock for years. In the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando G. S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá compañía Espartillar, es casado con un hijo.

              El Sr. Fernando G. se dedica a la venta ambulante de artesanía hace más de 10 años cuenta actualmente con más de 80 clientes. 
Sus productos vendidos son generalmente productos de artesanía todos hechos y producidos en la misma ciudad de Carapeguá.
Ademas de la venta ambulante que el realiza el tambien posee un negocio de venta de productos de uso domesticos.
Pero la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la venta de artesania ya que en la atencion del negocio lo su señora.

          Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará muchas artesanías como hamacas de hilos, frazadas, sabanas bordadas, manteles y otros.
texts.en:
Fernando G. S. is from the Espartillar neighborhood in the capital city of Carapegua, and is married with one child. Mr G. makes a living selling crafts door to door which he has done for the last 10 years, and currently has more than 80 customers. The craft products he normally sells are made in Carapegua. Besides his door to door business he also has a business selling daily use products. However, the majority of his time is spent selling crafts since his wife takes care of the other business. With this loan he will buy a number of different craft items such as hammocks, blankets, embroidered sheets, table cloths and others.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hammocks, blankets, embroidered sheets, table cloths and others.

loans.name: Ruphina

texts.en:
Ruphina is a very hard working woman with seven children. Since childhood, she has faced many obstacles in life because her parents were poor and could not send her to school after class six of primary school. Instead, she had to go to work on the family farm and help to pay for the education of her younger sibling. Despite this outcome, she cannot read and write. In spite of these limitations, she has set out to overcome poverty and to provide her children with the education she did not have. She also hopes someday to go back to school herself.
 
With these goals in mind, Ruphina joined GHAPE from its inception. So determined she was with her previous loans, which she used to buy land, she has been able to build a house for herself and her children.

With this new loan, she plans to buy one-day chicks, piglets, fowl, feed, pig feed feeders, medication for fowls and pigs and seedlings for her farm. She is contributing 100,000 FRS CFA from her personal savings to the success of this, her project. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of one day chicks, fowl, pig feed, feeders and seedlings.

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: N. Charles est un homme de 40 ans, il est née en district Kicukiro en ville de Kigali capital du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est primaire.  Il est commençant de détail en boutique. Il contracte un prêt pour acheter des  savons, sucre et du sel pour augmenter  son capital et sa capacité de ventes en vue de gagner tous les clients de son quartier. Il a ouvert un compte dans Amasezerano Community Banking   depuis 2007, avec ce prêt il veut augmenter les épargnes afin de réhabiliter  sa maison d’habitation, l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaires  lui permettra de payer le minerval pour ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et avoir fait un gros magasin  dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Charles N. is a 40-year-old man, born in the Kicukiro district in Kigali, the Rwandan capital. He has a primary school education and is beginning to sell retail in a store. He is requesting a loan to buy soaps, sugar, and salt to increase his capital and his selling capacity in order to attract all the potential customers in the neighborhood. He opened an account with Amasezerano Community Banking in 2007. With this loan, he wishes to increase his savings in order to repair his house. An increase in his business income will allow him to pay his childrens’ school fees, improve living conditions for his family, and have a large store in the future.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, salt, and soaps

loans.name: Dora Emilia

texts.es:
Dora Emilia Vázquez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien inicio con una pequeña venta de chiverías hace diez años. Este negocio  gracias a los préstamos y una ardua labor fue creciendo hasta convertirse en una pulpería. Asimismo ha ido invirtiendo en otros rubros como la  elaboración de tortillas y venta de carne de cerdo. 

Esta señora de 60 años sueña con mejorar su casa la cual es su meta principal; pero el crédito actual será utilizado para la compra de productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Emilia Vázquez, 60, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who started out with a small yogurt selling business ten years ago. Thanks to financing and hard work the business gradually grew until it became a grocery store. She has also invested in other lines of work like making tortillas and selling pork. Emilia dreams with making improvements to her home; this is her main goal. However, this loan will be used to buy stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa V. is 34 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Palepa has many years of experience in this business.  Palepa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Palepa joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Palepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha C. is from the village of Angayoso, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately $206 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Martha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Martha is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 11th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Don Jorge M. M. quiere comprarse una vaquita lechera. 
El vive en la comunidad del Sauce de Cartago, caracterizado por su cercanía al espectacular volcán Turrialba y por atracción del turismo de montaña gracias a su acogedor Clima.
Don Jorge se ha dedicado toda su vida a la lechería, y hoy necesita un crédito de ¢500 000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca lechera, el asegura que con ella aumentara su producción y así mejora las condiciones  económica de su familia.
El  es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su cuarto   préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Jorge M. M. wants to buy a milking cow. He lives in the community of Sauce de Cartago, known for its spectacular proximity to the Turrialba volcano and for the popular tourist attraction of the mountains and its pleasant climate. Jorge has been a milk farmer all his life and currently he requires a loan of 600 000 (six hundred thousand) colones to purchase a milking cow. With her help he will improve his production and improve the financial situation of his family. He is a member of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, one of the 100 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica. This will be his fourth loan and he hopes to keep improving himself and his finances.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “MUJERES SIN FRONTERAS”, se encuentra ubicada en la San Juana Bautista 3ª Etapa en el distrito de Comas, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 8 socios quienes se desempeñan en labores de comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 8 meses.
Sara Delfina emprendedora y entusiasta, tiene 50 años,  es madre soltera, ya que su conviviente falleció hace 10 años y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos viven con ella.
Desde hace 6 meses se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto de mercado (menú criollo), el cual lleva por nombre “SARITA”, se inicio en este negocio ya que anteriormente, durante muchos años se desempeño como cocinera en una clínica, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y a base de mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda y acaba de techarlo, pero aun le falta el acabado final, con el ingreso de su negocio cubre los gastos de alimentos, pago de servicios, educación, etc. 
El gran anhelo de Sara es tener su propio restaurante en su vivienda y contratar personal para así generar empleo para los demás.
Con el reciente préstamo adquirido los socios de la alcancía, lo utilizaran en la compra de mercadería y otros artículos  para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES SIN FRONTERAS” (Women Without Borders) communal bank is located in the third stage of San Juana Bautista, in the Comas district, within the Lima department.  It’s made up of eight members who run small businesses and who’ve been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the past eight months.

Sara Delfina is an enthusiastic entrepreneur.  She is a 50 year old single mother whose husband passed away ten years ago.  She has four children, two of whom live with her.

She’s been selling food (Creole style) from a stall in the market for six months.  Her business is called “SARITA” and she started it after having worked as a cook in a clinic for many years.  With the effort she puts into her work, and also much more effort, she’s managed to build her house and has recently installed a roof, but it still needs some final touches.  She uses the income from her work to pay for food, services, education, etc.

Sara’s greatest desire is to have her own restaurant in her home and to hire people so that she can provide work for others.

The communal bank members will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise and other items to cover their customer demand.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anrasiya

texts.en: Anrasiya A. makes a living selling charcoal at a local market and is applying for a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers. She is 35 years old and married to a businessman. The couple has four children, all of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jaquline

texts.en: Jaquline M. is a 31-year-old M-Pesa (a mobile-phone based money transfer service) business owner in Changamwe, Mombasa. She is a single mother of one who has successfully been in this business for the last two years. She is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to open another M-Pesa outlet and will use the anticipated profit to increase her float. She hopes to develop her business wisely in future.

loans.use: to open another M-Pesa

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Chhoun S. Un, 28, is a professional tailor, making US$ 3 each day in Takeo province. She is married and has two children living at home to support. Her husband, Tang Rim, makes approximately US$ 2.50 every day, working in construction. Chhoun S. Un would like a loan of US$ 300 to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.name: People Yone Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “People Yone” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Musu T. is the leader of this group. The 22-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Musu has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells market food – vegetable oil, groundnuts, fish, sugar and other cooking condiments. With her share of this loan, she will be able to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in larger quantities to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Wallie Mansaray, handing the loan to the clients.)

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil, groundnuts, fish, sugar and cooking condiments in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K., 28-years-old, runs a retail shop in Kiwanja. He is married to Ann Mutile and together they have one child. He has been running his shop for 2 years and his monthly profit is 15,000 KSH.

He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office. This loan of 70,000 KSH is Simon's third loan with KADET and he intends to increase the inventory of sugar, wheat, flour and rice in his store. He hopes that the loan will boost his business, so that he can expand it and increase the standard of living of his family.

Simon plans to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of sugar, wheat, flour and rice

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Betty; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de peluches, ella vende en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja en un hostal, la socia lleva a las diferentes tiendas para hacer los peluches, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los peluches. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar peluches al por mayor.  
                                               
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Betty is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cuddly toys.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  She also works in a hostel.  Betty takes her products to different stores.  She would like to own a store where she could sell her cuddly toys.  She is requesting this loan to buy more cuddly toys wholesale.

Betty is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy cuddly toys wholesale

loans.name: Madaminjon

texts.en:
E. Madaminjon is a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He is the father of two children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, after much time Madaminjon was able to get ahead through his business of purchasing cattle and breeding them on his property. His greatest goal is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family.  For this reason, Madaminjon came to IMON International for loans to purchase animals for his breeding business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.ru: Nuraddin M. rodilsya v 1972 qodu. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. Nuraddin, yeqo lubimaya jena i rebonok jivut v qorode Baku. Nuraddin uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya stroitlstvom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svayeqo otca , s detstva koqda yeqo otec rabotal o vse vremya interesovalsya etoy rabotoy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit nujniye pribori dlya stroitelstva.
texts.en: Nuraddin Mammadiv was born in 1972.  He is married and has one child, who currently attends school.  Nuraddin, his beloved wife and child live in the city of Baku.
